hicetaon: <entryFree id="n20642" type="main" key="Hi^ce^ta_on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭcĕtāon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(iketa/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n20642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Laomedon king of Troy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 152, 9</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n20642.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭcĕtāŏnĭus</orth>, a <pb n="854" /> <cb n="HIEM" /> um, <hi rend="ital">of Hicetāon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thymoetes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>his son</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 123</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hicetas: <entryFree id="n20643" type="main" key="Hi^ce^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭcĕtas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ike/tas</foreign>. <sense id="n20643.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A tyrant of Leontini</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Tim. 2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Tim. 2, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20643.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A philosopher of Syracuse</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 39, 123</bibl> dub. (al. Nicetas).</sense></entryFree>
hicine: <entryFree id="n20644" type="main" key="hicine1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hicine, haecine</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">hocine</orth>, v. hic, I. B.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n20645" type="main" key="hicine2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hicine</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. hic, III. 2 <sense id="n20645.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
hicne: <entryFree id="n20646" type="main" key="hicne"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hicne</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">haecne</orth>, etc., v. hic, B. <sense id="n20646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
hiemalis: <entryFree id="n20647" type="main" key="hi^e^ma_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭĕmālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hiems</etym>, <sense id="n20647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to winter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wintry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winter-.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20647.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">arbores ut hiemali tempore tempestive caedi putentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:14:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circulus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the tropic of Capricorn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 3:26" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiemalem vim perferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:27:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 27, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circum murum planities limosa hiemalibus aquis paludem fecerat,</quote> <trans><tr>by the rains of winter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 37:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 37, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 105</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">hibernae aquae Albulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:390" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 390</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">faba,</quote> <trans><tr>winter bean</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 23, 52, § 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <trans><tr>winter apartments</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totis hoc Alpibus notum et hiemalibus provinciis,</quote> <trans><tr>cold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 12, § 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigatio longa et hiemalis,</quote> <trans><tr>stormy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Luna,</quote> <trans><tr>bringing cold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 79, § 349</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20647.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭĕmālia</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, for the usual hiberna, <hi rend="ital">winter-quarters</hi> (post-class. and very rare): hiemalia atque aestiva disponere, Val. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hiematio: <entryFree id="n20648" type="hapax" key="hi^e^ma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭĕmātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>hiemo</etym>, <sense id="n20648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a passing the winter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wintering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquum (mellis) hiemationi relinquatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:34" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hiemo: <entryFree id="n20649" type="main" key="hi^e^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭĕmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n20649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [hiems]. </sense><sense id="n20649.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20649.2" n="A" level="2"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">to pass the winter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to winter;</hi> of soldiers, <hi rend="ital">to keep in winter-quarters</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi piratae quotannis hiemare soleant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:47:section=104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 47, § 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naviget ac mediis hiemet mercator in undis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assidue in Urbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tres (legiones), quae circum Aquileiam hiemabant, ex hibernis educit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legionem hiemandi causa collocaret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupio scire quid agas et ubi sis hiematurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies me certiorem, quomodo hiemaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n20649.3" n="B" level="2"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">to be wintry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frozen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stormy</hi> (freq. since the Aug. per.; not in Cic.): hiemantes aquae, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">atrum Defendens pisces hiemat mare,</quote> <trans><tr>storms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 47, § 125</bibl>; cf.: repente hiemavit tempestas ... totus hiemavit annus ... hiemante Aquilone, Arrunt. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">delphini vespertino occasu continui dies hiemant Italiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 64, § 235</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20649.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>, hiemat, <hi rend="ital">it is winter weather</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wintry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frosty</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">decimo sexto Cal. Febr. Cancer desinit occidere: hiemat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehementer hiemat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:ib. 20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiemat cum frigore et gelicidiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:ib. 78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:348" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 79, § 348</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20649.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to congeal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">freeze</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn to ice</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">decoquunt alii aquas, mox et illas hiemant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4, 19, § 55</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">decoquere aquam vitroque demissam in nives refrigerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 3, 23, § 40</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">hiemato lacu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 22, 38, § 75</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hiempsal: <entryFree id="n20650" type="main" key="Hi^empsal"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭempsal</orth>, <itype>ălis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n20650.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Micipsa and king of Numidia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:8:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 71</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20650.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Another king of Numidia</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">son of the former</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20650.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Mauritania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:5:12 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 5, 12 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
hiems: <entryFree id="n20651" type="main" key="hi^ems"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭems</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">hiemps</orth>, <itype>ĕmis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xiw/n, xei=ma</foreign>; Sanscr. himas, snow</etym>, <sense id="n20651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the winter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winter time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rainy season</hi> (cf.: bruma, solstitium). </sense><sense id="n20651.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: aestatem autumnus sequitur, post acer hiemps fit, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 647</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 406 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">solvitur acris hiems grata vice veris et Favoni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: crudelis, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 891</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 482 Vahl.); <cit><quote lang="la">opp. to aestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:20:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 20, 1</bibl></cit>, §§ <cit><quote lang="la">31 and 32: dies primus est veris in Aquario, aestatis in Tauro, autumni in Leone, hiemis in Scorpione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:28:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 28, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:84" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 47, § 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:224" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 25, 60, § 224</bibl> sq.: prodit hiems, sequitur crepitans hanc dentibus algor. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:747" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 747</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc vim frigorum hiememque, quam nos vix hujus urbis tectis sustinemus, excipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:15:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:40:section=86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 40, § 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 12, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravissimā hieme,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamque hiems appropinquabat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">initā hieme,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 3, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam prope hieme confectā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 32, 2</bibl></cit>: <cb n="HIER" /> ante exactam hiemem, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiems jam praecipitaverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 25, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modestia hiemis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum difficillimum gessit hieme anni,</quote> <trans><tr>in winter time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stridebat deformis hiems,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:58" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 58</bibl></cit>: Arabes campos et montes hieme et aestate peragrantes, <hi rend="ital">winter and summer</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in all seasons</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:42:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 42, 94</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">confligunt hiemes aestatibus acres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:373" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 373</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est ubi plus tepeant hiemes?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">informīs hiemes reducit Juppiter, idem Summovet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 10, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in his locis maturae sunt hiemes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 20, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:19:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 19, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">seu plures hiemes, seu tribuit Juppiter ultimam,</quote> <trans><tr>years</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post certas hiemes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sic multas hiemes atque octogensima vidit solstitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:92" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 92</bibl></cit>.—Personified: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hiems</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 212</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 436</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 120</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n20651.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n20651.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Rainy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stormy weather</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a storm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tempest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imber Noctem hiememque ferens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non tam creber agens hiemem ruit aequore turbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:470" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 470</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter horridus austris Torquet aquosam hiemem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:671" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 9, 671</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:321" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 321</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:52" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:490" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 490</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">521</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 709 al.</bibl>—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:22" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:36" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 36</bibl>.—In prose: <cit><quote lang="la">maritimos cursus praecludebat hiemis magnitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (gubernator) navem ex hieme marique scopuloso servat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n20651.4" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">cold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chill; tempest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violence</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">sic letalis hiems paulatim in pectora venit,</quote> <trans><tr>a deadly chill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:827" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 827</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:46:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 46, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vesuvinus apex et flammea diri Montis hiems,</quote> <trans><tr>the fiery tempest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:5:72" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 5, 72</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of Vesuvius: vix dum ignea montem Torsit hiems,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:508" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 508</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instamus jactu telorum et ferrea nimbis Certat hiems,</quote> <trans><tr>the iron storm</tr>, <tr>shower of weapons</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:386" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 386</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20651.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n20651.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Cold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">storm</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ab illa Pessima (die) mutati coepit amoris hiems,</quote> <trans><tr>cold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiems rerum,</quote> <trans><tr>the storm of war</tr>, <tr>disturbance of war</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 151</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20651.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Trouble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suae senectuti acriorem hiemem parat, quom illam inportunam tempestatem conciet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hiera: <entryFree id="n20652" type="greek" key="hi^e^ra1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭĕra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. antidotus), = <foreign lang="greek">i(era/</foreign> (sacred; <sense id="n20652.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Lat. sacra),</quote> <trans><tr>a sort of antidote against poison</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 99" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:156" default="NO">156</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20652.1" n="II" level="1"> Perh. = corona, <hi rend="ital">a garland</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hieran fecimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 83:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 83, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n20653" type="main" key="Hi^e^ra2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭĕra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n20653.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of several islands</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:18" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 106, 110, § 238</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:70 al" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 12, 23, § 70 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n20653.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭĕra Cōme</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a place in Caria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 12, 10</bibl>; cf. 38, 15, 7; 37, 19, 7.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n20658" type="main" key="Hi^e^ra3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭĕra Cōme</orth>, v. 2. Hiera, II.</entryFree>
hierabotane: <entryFree id="n20654" type="greek" key="hi^e^ra_bo^ta^ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭĕrābŏtănē</orth> (also separately <orth extent="full" lang="la">hie-ra botane</orth>), <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(era\ bota/nh</foreign> (sacred plant), <sense id="n20654.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> verbenaca, <hi rend="ital">vervain</hi>, Verbena officinalis, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 9, 59, § 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 163" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 163</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hieracia: <entryFree id="n20655" type="greek" key="hi^e^ra_ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭĕrācĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(eraki/a</foreign>, <sense id="n20655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hawkweed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 7, 26, § 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hieracitis: <entryFree id="n20656" type="greek" key="hi^e^ra_ci_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭĕrācītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(eraki=tis</foreign> (hawk-stone), <sense id="n20656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 60, § 167</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:187" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 11, 72, § 187</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hieracium: <entryFree id="n20657" type="greek" key="hi^e^ra_ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭĕrācĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(era/kion</foreign>, <sense id="n20657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of eye-salve</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 11, 27, § 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hierapolis: <entryFree id="n20659" type="main" key="Hi^e^ra_po^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭĕrāpŏlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(iera/polis</foreign>. <sense id="n20659.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of Great Phrygia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Pambouk Kaleh</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 93, 95, § 208</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Col. 4, 13</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n20659.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭĕrāpŏ-lītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Hierapolis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 29, § 105</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20659.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭĕrā-pŏlītāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, the same, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:20:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 20, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hieraticus: <entryFree id="n20660" type="greek" key="hi^e^ra_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭĕrātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(eratiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to sacred uses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hieratic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">charta hieratica appellatur antiquitus religiosis tantum voluminibus dicata, quae ablutione Augusti nomen accepit, sicut secunda Liviae, a conjuge ejus. Ita descendit hieratica in tertium nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 23, § 74</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hieremias: <entryFree id="n20661" type="main" key="Hi^e^re^mi_as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭĕrĕmīas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the prophet Jeremiah</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 450</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hiericus: <entryFree id="n20662" type="main" key="Hi^e^ri^cu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭĕrĭcūs</orth>, <itype>untis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ierikou=s</foreign>, <sense id="n20662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the city of Jericho</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Palestine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 14, 15, § 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:44" default="NO" valid="yes">13, 4, 9, § 44</bibl>.—Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Jĕrĭcho</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ierixw/</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 536</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Jerichon, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 480</bibl> Dressel. <cb n="HILA" /></sense></entryFree>
hiero: <entryFree id="n20663" type="main" key="Hi^e^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭĕro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ie/rwn</foreign>. <sense id="n20663.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Ruler of Syracuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a friend of the poet Simonides</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:22:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 22, 60</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 34, 83</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20663.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Hierocles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and ruler of Syracuse in the latter half of the third century B.C.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a friend of the Romans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:12:section=49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 12, § 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:37" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 4</bibl>; 26, 40; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:4:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 23, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:80" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 80</bibl>.—Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭĕrōnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Hiero</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex frumontaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:13:section=32 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 13, § 32 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 60, § 147</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 6, § 14</bibl> sq.</sense></entryFree>
hierocaesaria: <entryFree id="n20664" type="main" key="Hi^e^ro^caesa^ri_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭĕrŏcaesărīa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ierokaisa/reia</foreign>, <sense id="n20664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Lydia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 47</bibl>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭĕrŏcaesărĭenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">its inhabitants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 62</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hierocles: <entryFree id="n20665" type="main" key="Hi^e^ro_^cles"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭĕrō^cles</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ieroklh=s</foreign>, <sense id="n20665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated orator of Alabanda</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an older contemporary of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:95:325" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 95, 325</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:23:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 23, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:69:231" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 69, 231</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hierodulus: <entryFree id="n20666" type="greek" key="hi^e^ro^du_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭĕrŏdūlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(ero/doulos</foreign>, <sense id="n20666.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a temple servant</hi>, Firm. Math. 8, 21.</sense></entryFree>
hieroglyphicus: <entryFree id="n20667" type="greek" key="hi^e^rogly^phi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭĕroglyphĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(eroglufiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hieroglyphic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 21, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hierographicus: <entryFree id="n20668" type="greek" key="hi^e^ro^gra^phi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭĕrŏgrăphĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(erografiko/s</foreign>, i. q. hieroglyphicus, <sense id="n20668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hierographic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 15, 30</bibl></cit> dub. (al. hieroglyphicas).</sense></entryFree>
hieromnemon: <entryFree id="n20669" type="greek" key="hi^e^ro^mne_mon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭĕrŏmnēmon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(eromnh/mwn</foreign>, <sense id="n20669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, also called erotylos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 58, § 160</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hieronica: <entryFree id="n20670" type="greek" key="hi^e^ro^ni_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭĕrŏnīca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(eroni/khs</foreign>, <sense id="n20670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a conqueror in the sacred games</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neapolin albis equis introiit, disjecta parte muri, ut mos hieronicarum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2160</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2628</bibl> sq. al.</sense></entryFree>
hieronicus: <entryFree id="n20671" type="main" key="Hi^e^ro_ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭĕrōnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Hiero, II. <sense id="n20671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
hieronymus: <entryFree id="n20672" type="main" key="Hi^e^ro_ny^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭĕrōnymus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ierw/numos</foreign>. <sense id="n20672.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">a ruler of Syracuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the grandson and successor of the younger Hiero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:4 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 4 sq.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n20672.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Greek peripatetic philosopher of Rhodes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:3:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:6:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 30, 84</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 31, 87</bibl> sq.; 5, 41, 118.— </sense><sense id="n20672.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Jerome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a celebrated father of the Church in the fifth century of the Christian era</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Dial. 1, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hierophanta:
<entryFree id="n20673" type="greek" key="hi^e^ro^phanta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭĕrŏphanta</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tēs</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(erofa/nths</foreign>, <sense id="n20673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a teacher of religious rites and ceremonies</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a high-priest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hierophant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 174</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jovin. 1, 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: agrorum, <hi rend="ital">in the country</hi>, Cod. Th. 16, 4, 10; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2305</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2351</bibl> sq. (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 3, 2</bibl>, the word is spurious).
‡† <orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭĕrŏphantrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(erofa/ntria</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a priestess</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2361</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hierophylax: <entryFree id="n20674" type="greek" key="hi^e^ro^phy^lax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭĕrŏphylax</orth>, <itype>ăcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(erofu/lac</foreign>, <sense id="n20674.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the keeper of a temple</hi> (pure Lat. aedituus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:1:20:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 1, 20, § 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hierosolyma: <entryFree id="n20675" type="main" key="Hi^e^ro^so^ly^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭĕrŏsŏlyma</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (secondary forms; <sense id="n20675.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), = <foreign lang="greek">*(ieroso/luma</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the city of Jerusalem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Palestine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 14, 15, § 70</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 28, 67 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8</bibl>; 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:5:30" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 5, 30</bibl>.— Also, <hi rend="ital">fem. acc.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭĕrŏsŏlymam</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:5:30" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 5, 30</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:16:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 16, 21</bibl>; Marc. 10, 32 sq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Epit. 46, 7</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hiĕrū^-sălem</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 811</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> de Pass. Chr. 25</bibl>; and in many other eccl. fathers. —Also abbrev.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŏlyma</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:65:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 65, 5</bibl>, acc. to Tac.; <cit><quote lang="la">so called from the Solymi, a people of Lycia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 24, § 94</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20675.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n20675.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭĕrŏsŏlymārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Jerusalem;</hi> a surname given to Pompey after taking Jerusalem: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sciat hic noster Hierosolymarius traductor ad plebem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20675.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭĕrŏsŏ-lymītānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Jerusalem</hi>: regnum, Aug. Civ. Dei, 17, 21.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŏly-mus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Jerusalem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the Jews</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:544" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 544</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hieto: <entryFree id="n20676" type="main" key="hi^e^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭĕto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n20676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [for hiato, from hio; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 336</bibl> P.], <hi rend="ital">to open the mouth wide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to gape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yawn</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ego dum hieto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 336</bibl> P.: praei hercle tu, qui mihi oscitans hietansque restas, Caecil. ib.; Cn. Mat. ib.—*<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to open wide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throw open</hi>: hietantur fores, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 336</bibl> P. (Com. Rel. v. 89 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
hilaira: <entryFree id="n20677" type="main" key="Hilai_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hilaīra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ila/eira</foreign>, <sense id="n20677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daughter of Leucippus and bride of Ida</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:2:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 2, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hilare: <entryFree id="n20678" type="main" key="hi^la^re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭlărē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. hilaris <sense id="n20678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
hilaresco: <entryFree id="n20679" type="hapax" key="hi^la^resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭlăresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n20679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [hilaris], <hi rend="ital">to grow cheerful</hi> or <hi rend="ital">merry</hi>: cum amicorum <pb n="855" /> <cb n="HILA" /> domus fumat, hilaresco, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 121, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hilaria: <entryFree id="n20680" type="hapax" key="hi^la^ri^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭlărĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>hilaris</etym>, <sense id="n20680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gayety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">merriment</hi>: ebriulati mentem hilaria arripuit, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 108, 4</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 52 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n20681" type="main" key="hi^la^ri^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭlărĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. hilaris, II.</entryFree>
hilaris: <entryFree id="n20682" type="greek" key="hi^la^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭlăris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭlărus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(laro/s</foreign> [cf. Sanscr. hlād, rejoice; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xlaro/s</foreign>; Engl. glad], <sense id="n20682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cheerful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of good cheer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blithe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">merry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jocund</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jovial.—Adj.</hi> (class.; syn. laetus). </sense><sense id="n20682.1" n="(a)" level="5"> Form hilaris: <cit><quote lang="la">oderunt hilarem tristes tristemque jocosi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 89</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc (vultu) tristes, hoc hilares sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:72" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tristia dicamus hilares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse vultu hilari atque laeto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:42:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 42, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hilari animo esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem hilari ingenio et lepide accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut hunc festum diem Habeamus hilarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 6, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hilarem hunc sumamus diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetum hilaremque diem sentire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:41" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hilaris fluit (vox),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:63" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio (opp. tristis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causae (opp. tristes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:151" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod dicitur aut est lascivum et hilare aut contumeliosum.... In convictibus lasciva humilibus hilaria omnibus convenient,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infernis hilares sine regibus umbrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:52" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20682.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Form hilarus: <cit><quote lang="la">tristis sit (servus frugi), si eri sint tristes: hilarus sit, si gaudeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">credam istuc, si esse te hilarum videro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde ego omnes hilaros, lubentes, laetificantes faciam ut fiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fac te hilarum,</quote> <trans><tr>cheer up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc (librum) lege arcano convivis tuis, sed, si me amas hilaris et bene acceptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hilara vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:30:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 30, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hilaro vultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 26, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 19, 18, § 79</bibl>: fronte hilaro, corde tristi, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:9:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 9, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hilara sane Saturnalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 20, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1121</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20682.3" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fac nos hilaros hilariores opera atque adventu tuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu quidem pol et multo hilarior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hilarioribus oculis quam solitus eras, intuens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">attulit a te litteras hilariores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hilarior protinus renidet oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cutem in facie corrigit coloremque hilariorem facit,</quote> <trans><tr>brighter</tr>, <tr>fresher</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 8, 75, § 144</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 7, 11, § 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:48" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 10, 19, § 48</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20682.4" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo lepidissime atque hilarissime!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conviva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 72</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20682.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭlărĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the joyous festival celebrated in honor of Cybele at the vernal equinox</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hilaribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aurel. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hilariis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 37</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭlăre</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">class.</orth>), and <orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭlărĭ-ter</orth> (late Lat.), <hi rend="ital">cheerfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gayly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">joyfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">merrily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicimus aliquem hilare vivere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:30:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 30, 92</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">res tristes remisse, severas hilare tractare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 8, 30</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">hilare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 71, 290</bibl></cit>; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 514, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:2:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde modo acriter, tum clementer, maeste, hilare in omnes partes commutabimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 14, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 55, 68</bibl>: hilariter, Aug. Civ. Dei, 5, 26; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 6, 17</bibl>; cf. Neue, Formenl. 2, 660.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si hilarius locuti sunt (opp. in luctu esse),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:27:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 27, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hilaritas: <entryFree id="n20683" type="main" key="hi^la^ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭlărĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>hilaris</etym>, <sense id="n20683.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cheerfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gayety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good-humor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">joyousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">merriment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hilarity</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">hilaritatem illam, qua hanc tristitiam temporum condiebamus, in perpetuum amisi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:40:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 40, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tristitia deductis, hilaritas remissis (superciliis) ostenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hilaritate et lascivia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:20:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 20, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque hilaritatis plenum judicium ac laetitiae fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:57:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 57, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hilaritas illa nostra et suavitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat in M. Druso adulescente singularis severitas, in C. Laelio multa hilaritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:108" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 30, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in praecordiis praecipua hilaritatis sedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 77, § 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut hilaritate enitescant (oculi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:75" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceterae hilaritates non implent pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 23:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum diei permittit hilaritas,</quote> <trans><tr>fineness</tr>, <tr>pleasantness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 14, 18</bibl></cit>: arboris, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a fresh</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lively appearance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 16, 26, § 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hilariter: <entryFree id="n20684" type="main" key="hi^la^ri^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭlărĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. hilaris <sense id="n20684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
hilaritudo: <entryFree id="n20685" type="main" key="hi^la^ri^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭlărĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>hilaris</etym>, <sense id="n20685.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cheerfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">merriment</hi> (ante-class. for the class. hilaritas): numquam ego te tristiorem Vidi esse: quid cedo tam abhorret hilaritudo? <cb n="HINC" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">onera te hilaritudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in ocellis hilaritudo est!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hilaro: <entryFree id="n20686" type="main" key="hi^la^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭlăro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>hilaris</etym>, <sense id="n20686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make cheerful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cheer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gladden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhilarate</hi> (rare but class.): omnes jucundum motum, quo sensus hilaretur, Graece <foreign lang="greek">h(donh/n</foreign>, Latine voluptatem vocant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:3:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Periclis suavitate maxime hilaratae sunt Athenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:11:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 11, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 4, 4, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">picas mirum in modum hilarari, si interim audierint id verbum,</quote> <trans><tr>rejoice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 42, 59, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cum caelo hilarata videatur (terra),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:40:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 40, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hilaratus vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Festaque pallentes hilarent altaria lucos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:24" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 168</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hilarodos: <entryFree id="n20687" type="gloss" key="hilarodos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hilarodos</orth> <itype>lascivi et delicati carminis cantator</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=101:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 101, 10</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
hilarulus: <entryFree id="n20688" type="hapax" key="hi^la^ru^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭlărŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n20688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [hilaris], <hi rend="ital">cheerful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contented</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atticae, quoniam, quod optimum in pueris est, hilarula est, meis verbis suavium des,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
hilarus: <entryFree id="n20689" type="main" key="hi^la^rus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭlărus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. hilaris.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n20690" type="main" key="Hi^la^rus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭlărus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman freedman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 12, 2</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
hillae: <entryFree id="n20691" type="main" key="hillae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hillae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>hira</etym>, <sense id="n20691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the smaller and anterior intestines of animals</hi> (other than men and sheep). </sense><sense id="n20691.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab hoc ventriculo lactes in homine et ove, per quas labitur cibus, in ceteris hillae, a quibus capaciora intestina ad alvum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 79, § 200</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20691.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n20691.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">intestines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entrails</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hillas intestina veteres esse dixerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 122, 7</bibl></cit>; Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 122, 10</bibl>.—In mal. part., Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 12</bibl>. —* </sense><sense id="n20691.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of sausage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smoked sausage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hilotae: <entryFree id="n20692" type="main" key="Hi_lo_tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hīlōtae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ei(/lwtes</foreign>, <sense id="n20692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the original inhabitants of the city Helos</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">*(/elos</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">in Laconia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afterwards the bondsmen of the Spartans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Helots</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 3, 6</bibl>.— Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ilotae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 27, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hilum: <entryFree id="n20693" type="main" key="hi_lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hīlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>the primitive of nihilum, i. e. ne-hilum and nihil; etym. unknown; acc to Festus: hilum putant esse, quod grano fabae adhaeret, ex quo nihil et nihilum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=101" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 101</bibl> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hilum breve quoddam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 121, 3</bibl></cit>; acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=111" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 111</bibl> Müll., perh. kindr. with hillae</etym>, <sense id="n20693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a trifle;</hi> usually with a negative, <hi rend="ital">not in the least</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not a whit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nothing at all</hi> (ante-class.): (Ennius) Quae dedit ipsa capit, neque dispendi facit hilum; <cit><quote lang="la">quod valet: nec dispendi facit quicquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=54" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:5:section=111" default="NO">5, § 111</bibl> (Ann. v. 14 Vahl.); cf.: Sisyphus versat Saxum sudans nitendo neque proficit hilum, <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:6:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 6, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec defit ponderis hilum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque hilum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:518" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 518</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:783" default="NO" valid="yes">783</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:379" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 379</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: neque hilo Majorem interea capiunt dulcedinis fructum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1409" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1409</bibl></cit>.—Without a negative: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid prorsum de summa detrahere hilum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:514" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 514</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 515</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
himantopus: <entryFree id="n20694" type="greek" key="hi^manto^pu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭmantŏpūs</orth>, <itype>pŏdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(manto/pous, podos</foreign>, Lat. loripes, thongfoot, <sense id="n20694.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of long-legged water-fowl</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 47, 64, § 130</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20694.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭmantŏpŏdes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a people of Æthiopia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 8, 8, § 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:10:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 31, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Res. Gest. Alex. 3:19" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Res. Gest. Alex. 3, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
himella: <entryFree id="n20695" type="main" key="Hi^mella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭmella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small river in the Sabine territory</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Aia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:714" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 714</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
himera: <entryFree id="n20696" type="main" key="Hi_me^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hīmĕra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ime/ra</foreign>. <sense id="n20696.0" n="I" level="1"> M. and <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a river of Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which divides into two branches</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of which the northern one is now called Fiume Grande</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and the southern Fiume Salso</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:17" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:233" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 233</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20696.1" n="II" level="1"> F., <hi rend="ital">the city of Himera</hi>, <hi rend="ital">situated on the northern branch of the river of the same name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Lilybœum and Pelorus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:16" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:35:section=86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 35, § 86</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 33, § 73</bibl>.—Also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hīmĕra</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:475" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 475</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20696.2" n="B" level="2"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hīmĕraeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the city Himera</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Himeran</hi>: Demophilus, <hi rend="ital">of Himera</hi>,-<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 9, 36, § 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hinc: <entryFree id="n20697" type="main" key="hinc"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hinc</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>for hince, locative form from hic</etym>, <sense id="n20697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">from this place. hence.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20697.1" n="I" level="1"> In space: Imus huc: illuc hinc: cum illuc ventum est, ire illinc lubet, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:10:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 10, 12</bibl> (Trag. v. 258 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">abiit hinc in exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">In ea via, quae est hinc in Indiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:14:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 14, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui hinc Roma veneramus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:34:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 34, 94</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc a nobis profecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:13:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 13, 29</bibl></cit>: Ex Sicilia testes erant ii, qui, etc. ... et <cb n="HINN" /> hinc homines maxime illustres, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:6:section=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 6, § 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc Athenis civis eam emit Atticus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at enim ille hinc amat meretricem ex proxumo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illam hinc civem esse aiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 5, 10</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">out of this world</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 6:11" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 6, 11</bibl>.—Esp., in a book or writing, jam hinc, <hi rend="ital">from this point onward</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">majora jam hinc bella dicentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberi jam hinc populi Romani res gestas peragam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:35:14" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 35, 14</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n20697.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n20697.3" n="1" level="3"> I. q. ab or ex hac parte, <hi rend="ital">from this side</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on this side</hi>, <hi rend="ital">here</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperator utrimque hinc et illinc Jovi vota suscipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 74</bibl></cit>: ex hac parte pudor pugnat, illinc petulantia; hinc pudicitia, illinc stuprum; <cit><quote lang="la">hinc fides, illinc fraudatio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudor est, qui suadeat illinc: hinc dissuadet amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:619" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 619</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum speculorum levitas hinc illinc altitudinem assumpsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis hinc atque illinc vulneribus acceptis,</quote> <trans><tr>on each side</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 10, 12</bibl></cit>.—So too: hinc ... hinc, <hi rend="ital">on this side ... on that side</hi>, <hi rend="ital">here ... there</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc patres, hinc viros orantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 13, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Cassandrea hinc Toronaico, hinc Macedonico saepta mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 11, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 8, 8</bibl>: hinc atque hinc vastae rupes geminique minantur In caelum scopuli, i. e. <hi rend="ital">on each side</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">e)/nqen kai\ e)/nqen</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 162</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi impetus hinc atque illinc facti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duos corvos hinc et inde infestantes,</quote> <trans><tr>from different directions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:96" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 96</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">hinc et inde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc inde hortantium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 27</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">hinc inde,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc inde jacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 13, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 33, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20697.4" n="2" level="3"> With reference to the origin or cause of any thing (v. ab and ex), <hi rend="ital">from this source</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from this cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hence; on this account</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc quodcumque in solum venit, ut dicitur, effingis atque efficis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:23:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 23, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videret hinc (i. e. ex auro) dona fortium fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 12, 54, § 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc sicae, hinc venena, hinc falsa testamenta nascuntur: hinc furta, hinc opum nimiarum potentiae non ferendae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:8:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 8, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 23, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:31:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 31, 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurima hinc orta vitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:74" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 74</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut posset hinc esse metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6</bibl></cit> praef. § 10; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 6, 1: hinc enim accidit dubitatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc illae lacrimae!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 99</bibl></cit>; imitated by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:25:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 25, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 41</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ellipt.: hinc illae sollicitationes servorum: hinc illae quaestiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:67:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 67, 191</bibl></cit>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 97</bibl>: sed eccum Syrum ire video! hinc scibo jam, ubi siet (acc. to scire ex aliquo; <cit><quote lang="la">v. scio),</quote> <trans><tr>from him</tr>, <tr>this person</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc canere incipiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 62, 88, § 186</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jam hinc igitur ad rationem sermonis conjuncti transeamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 40</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">jam hinc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:11:1" default="NO">2, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:4" default="NO">10, 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc jam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO">8</bibl> praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">13: atque hinc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 1, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20697.5" n="II" level="1"> In time. </sense><sense id="n20697.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">From this time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after this</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hereupon</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">puerum in specu septem et quinquaginta dormisse annis: hinc pari numero dierum senio ingruente, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 52, 53, § 175</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:672" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 672</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumdata hinc regi specie honoris valida manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20697.7" n="B" level="2"> For abhinc, <hi rend="ital">ago</hi>, <hi rend="ital">since</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">me nemo magis respiciet, ubi iste huc venerit, Quam si hinc ducentos annos fuerim mortuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septimo hinc anno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 3, 4, § 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hinna: <entryFree id="n20698" type="main" key="hinna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hinna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. hinnus, I.</entryFree>
hinnibilis: <entryFree id="n20699" type="main" key="hinni_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hinnībĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hinnio</etym>, <sense id="n20699.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that neighs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neighing</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod hinnibile est, equus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3, p. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exscreatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:10:119" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 10, 119</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hinnibundus: <entryFree id="n20700" type="main" key="hinni^bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hinnĭbundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">constantly neighing</hi>: equi, Quadrig. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 122, 14</bibl> (Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2, p. 236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, p. 236</bibl> ex conj.; MSS. hinnibunde).</sense></entryFree>
hinnienter: <entryFree id="n20701" type="main" key="hinni^enter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hinnĭenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. hinnio <sense id="n20701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
hinnio: <entryFree id="n20702" type="main" key="hinni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hinnĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype> (<sense id="n20702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> hinnisset, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:3" default="NO"><author>Val.
