Max.</author> 7, 3</bibl>, ext. 2), <pos>v. n.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to neigh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whinny</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut si finias equum, genus est animal, species mortale, differentia irrationale (nam et homo mortale erat), proprium hinniens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1077" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1077</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: hinnientium dulcedines, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of horses</hi>, Laev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 294</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of the centaur Chiron, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 14, 29</bibl>.—Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">hinnĭenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">with neighing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinnibunde pro hinnienter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 122, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hinnitat: <entryFree id="n20703" type="gloss" key="hinni_tat"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hinnītat</orth> <foreign lang="greek">xremetizei</foreign>, Gloss. Philox. [<sense id="n20703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">freq.</hi> v. hinnio].</sense></entryFree>
hinnitus: <entryFree id="n20704" type="main" key="hinni_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hinnītus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>hinnio</etym>, <sense id="n20704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a neighing</hi>: <pb n="856" /> <cb n="HIPP" /> subito exaudivit hinnitum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:33:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 33, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1073" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1073</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 34</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 154</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">669</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hinnulea: <entryFree id="n20705" type="hapax" key="hinnu^le^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hinnŭlĕa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ŭla</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>hinnuleus</etym>, <sense id="n20705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a young hind</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 185</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hinnuleus: <entryFree id="n20706" type="main" key="hinnu^le^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hinnŭlĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>hinnus</etym>, <sense id="n20706.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a young stag</hi> or <hi rend="ital">roebuck</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:13:35" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 13, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 23, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 42, § 150</bibl>.—As <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:13" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20706.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A young mule</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=28" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 28</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
hinnulus: <entryFree id="n20707" type="main" key="hinnu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hinnŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20707.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a young mule</hi>: tu tuum sodalem Hinnulo videas strigosiorem, Maecen. ap. Suet. Vit. Hor. (al. hinno me v. str-); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 44, 69, § 172</bibl> Sill. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> and: hinnulus <foreign lang="greek">o( e)c i(/ppou kai\ o)/nou</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 5, 19</bibl>; Cantic. 2, 17; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 12, 1, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hinnus: <entryFree id="n20708" type="greek" key="hinnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hinnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(/nnos</foreign>, <sense id="n20708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mule</hi> (from a stallion and a she-ass; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. mulus, from a he-ass and a mare): ex equa et asino fit mulus: contra ex equo et asina hinnus ... Hinnus est ex equo et asina, minor quam mulus corpore, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:8:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:6" default="NO">6</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hinnos et hinnas sub quo sensu accipere debeamus Varro designat: ait enim ex equis et hinnulis (leg. asinabus) qui nascantur, hinnos vocari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 122, 4 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:37:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 37, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20708.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in the form <orth extent="full" lang="la">ginnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gi/nnos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a little stunted mule</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non aliter monstratur Atlas cum compare ginno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:77:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 77, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in plurium Graecorum est monumentis, cum equa muli coitu natum, quem vocaverint ginnum, id est parvum mulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 44, 69, § 174</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hio: <entryFree id="n20709" type="main" key="hi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n20709.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [weakened from <foreign lang="greek">*x*a*w, xai/nw, xa/skw</foreign>; cf. Germ. gähnen]. </sense><sense id="n20709.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stand</hi> or <hi rend="ital">be open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to gape.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20709.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n20709.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): hiavit humus multa, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 318, 29</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(calor) venas astringit hiantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasti specus hiant defractis membris (colossi Rhodii),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 7, 18, § 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:8:5" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 8, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec flos ullus hiat pratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 2, 45; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hiantia lilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quercum patulis rimis hiantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:16:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Qui potuit videre? <hi rend="ital">Ac.</hi> Oculis. <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Quo pacto? <hi rend="ital">Ac.</hi> Hem hiantibus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi hiantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 52, § 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pisciculi in concham hiantem innataverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:48:123" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 48, 123</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20709.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to open the mouth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to gape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yawn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inceptus clamor frustratur hiantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:493" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 493</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdices hiantes, exserta lingua aestuant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 33, 51, § 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trochilos crocodilum invitat ad hiandum pabuli sui gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 25, 37, § 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leo immane hians,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:726" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 726</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupus (piscis) hic Tiberinus an alto Captus hiet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profluentem aquam hianti ore captantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20709.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n20709.6" n="1" level="3"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">to be badly connected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to leave a hiatus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (vocalium concursus) cum accidit, hiat et intersistit et quasi laborat oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hiare semper vocalibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 20</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (poëtae), ut versum facerent, saepe hiabant: ut Naevius: Vos qui accolitis Histrum fluvium atque algidam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:45:152" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 45, 152</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: crebrae vocalium concursiones, quae vastam atque hiantem orationem reddunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 12, 18</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">concursus hiantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:6:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspera et dura et dissoluta et hians oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:62" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hians compositio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiantia loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:9:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 9, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20709.7" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to I. A. 2.) <hi rend="ital">To gape</hi>, with longing, wonder, or curiosity; <hi rend="ital">to be eager</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to long</hi> for any thing; <hi rend="ital">to be amazed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic homini si cujus domus patet, utrum ea patere an hiare ac poscere aliquid videtur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:4:section=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 4, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canis semper ad spem futuri hiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 72" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 72 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">corvum deludet hiantem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the legacy-hunter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne facies (equi) emptorem inducat hiantem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ducit hiantem Cretata ambitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:176" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avaritiā semper hiante esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:54:section=134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 54, § 134</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc plausus hiantem Per cuneos ... Corripuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:508" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 508</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxus et ignavia lacerabat hiantem Desidia populum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:35" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20709.8" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to spew out</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">subitos ex ore cruores Saucia tigris hiat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>spits</tr>, <tr>emits</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:706" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 706</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20709.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bawl out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabula seu maesto ponatur hianda tragoedo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:3" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen lyra,</quote> <trans><tr>plays</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:31:6" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 31, 6</bibl></cit> (3, 29, 6 M.).</sense></entryFree>
hippacare: <entryFree id="n20710" type="gloss" key="hippaca_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hippacāre</orth> est celeriter animam ducere<cb n="HIPP" />  ab equi halitu, qui est supra modum acutus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=101" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 101</bibl> Müll.; cf.: ‡ hippicare = oscitare, badare, Gloss. Isid.</entryFree>
hippace: <entryFree id="n20711" type="greek" key="hippa^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hippăcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(ppa/kh</foreign>. <sense id="n20711.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Cheese made of mare's milk</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 34, § 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:204" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 14, 58, § 204</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20711.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, now unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 44, § 83</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hippagines: <entryFree id="n20712" type="gloss" key="hippa_gi^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hippāgĭnes</orth> <itype>naves, quibus equi vehuntur</itype>, quas Graeci <foreign lang="greek">i(ppagwgou/s</foreign> dicunt, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=101" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 101</bibl> Müll.; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:25:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 25, 5</bibl>; cf. hippagogi and hippegus.</entryFree>
hippagogi: <entryFree id="n20713" type="greek" key="hippa^go_gi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hippăgōgi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype> (Gr. <case>acc.</case>-gūs, <sense id="n20713.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(ppagwgoi/</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">vessels for transporting horses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cavalry-transports</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinque et triginta naves, quas hippagogus vocant, ab Elea profectae, cum equitibus Gallis equisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 28, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. hippagines and hippegus.</sense></entryFree>
hippagus: <entryFree id="n20714" type="greek" key="hippa_gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hippāgus</orth>, v. hippegus.</entryFree>
hippalus: <entryFree id="n20715" type="main" key="Hippa^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hippălus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20715.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">another name of the wind</hi> Favonius, <hi rend="ital">in the Indian Ocean</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 26, § 104</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hipparchus: <entryFree id="n20716" type="main" key="Hipparchus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hipparchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(/ipparxos</foreign>. <sense id="n20716.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Pisistratus tyrant of Athens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and brother of Hippias</hi>, <hi rend="ital">killed by Harmodius and Aristogiton</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:21:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 21, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20716.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated astronomer of Nicœa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 26, 24, § 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 12, 9, § 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:188" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 77, 79, § 188</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:7:7 al" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 7, 7 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
hipparinus: <entryFree id="n20717" type="main" key="Hippa^ri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hippărīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ippari=nos</foreign>, <sense id="n20717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of the father of Dion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion. 1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion. 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hipparis: <entryFree id="n20718" type="main" key="Hippa^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hippăris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small river of Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flowing by the city of Camarina</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whence it is now called Fiume di Camarana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:230" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 230</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hippasus: <entryFree id="n20719" type="main" key="Hippa^sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hippăsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n20719.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Eurytus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 313</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20719.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A centaur</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 352</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hippegus: <entryFree id="n20720" type="greek" key="hippe_gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hippēgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(pphgo/s</foreign> (sc. navis), <sense id="n20720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a transport for cavalry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 209</bibl>; cf. hippagogi.</sense></entryFree>
hippeus: <entryFree id="n20721" type="greek" key="hippeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hippeus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>), ĕï, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(ppeu/s</foreign> (horseman), <sense id="n20721.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of comet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hippeus equinas jubas (habet),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 25, 22, § 90</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hippias: <entryFree id="n20722" type="main" key="Hippias"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hippias</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ippi/as</foreign>. <sense id="n20722.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Pisistratus tyrant of Athens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and brother of Hipparchus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after whose assassination he fled to the Persians; he fell in the battle of Marathon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:2:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 2, 10</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n20722.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A famous sophist of Elis in the time of Socrates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:8:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 8, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">85, 292</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:32:127 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 32, 127 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n20722.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A famous painter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 141</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hippius: <entryFree id="n20723" type="main" key="Hippius" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hippius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 76</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n20723.1" n="2" level="3"> ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hippius</orth>, <itype>id est equester, Neptunus dictus est</itype>, etc., Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=101" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 101</bibl> Müll. [= <foreign lang="greek">*(/ippeios</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*(/ippios</foreign>].</sense></entryFree>
hippo: <entryFree id="n20724" type="main" key="Hippo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hippo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ippw/n</foreign>, <sense id="n20724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several cities.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20724.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of Numidia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also with the surname of</hi> regius, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*(ippw\n basiliko/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">afterwards a bishop's see</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Bonah</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:7:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:259" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 259</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20724.2" n="II" level="1"> Hippo Diarrhytus, <foreign lang="greek">*(ippw\n dia/rrutos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a city of Zeugitana</hi>, <hi rend="ital">west of Utica</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Ben Zert</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 3, § 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 8, 8, § 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl> —</sense><sense id="n20724.3" n="B" level="2"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hippōnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Hippo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 3, § 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 33, 2</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hippōnenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Hippo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 8, 8, § 26</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n20724.4" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <hi rend="ital">near Toletum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20724.5" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The previous name of</hi> Vibo, <hi rend="ital">in the territory of the Bruttii</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 10, § 73</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hippocamelus: <entryFree id="n20725" type="greek" key="hippo^ca^me_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hippŏcămēlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(ppoka/mhlos</foreign>, <sense id="n20725.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fabulous animal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half horse and half camel</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hippocampus: <entryFree id="n20726" type="greek" key="hippo^campus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hippŏcampus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(ppo/kampos</foreign>, <sense id="n20726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sea-horse</hi>: Syngnathus hippocampus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 149</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:67" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 7, 23, § 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:93" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 9, 30, § 93</bibl>; 36, 5, 4, § 26; Naev. and Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 120, 17</bibl> and 19.</sense></entryFree>
hippocentaurus: <entryFree id="n20727" type="greek" key="hippo^centaurus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hippŏcentaurus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(ppoke/vtaupos</foreign>, <sense id="n20727.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fabulous creature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half horse and half man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hippocentaur</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:37:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 37, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 3, 3, § 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis rem quae in rerum natura non est aut esse non potest, velut hippocentaurum stipuletur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:97" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 97</bibl></cit> a.</sense></entryFree>
hippocomus: <entryFree id="n20728" type="greek" key="hippo^co^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hippŏcŏmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(ppoko/mos</foreign>, <sense id="n20728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a groom</hi>, Cod. Th. 8, 5, 37.</sense></entryFree>
hippocoon: <entryFree id="n20729" type="main" key="Hippo^co^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hippŏcŏon</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n20729.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of Amyclœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Enœsimus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who took part in the Calydonian hunt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 314</bibl> and 363; <cb n="HIPP" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 173" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 173</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20729.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A companion of Æneas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an archer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:492" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 492</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 273" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 273</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hippocoum: <entryFree id="n20730" type="gloss" key="hippocoum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hippocoum</orth> <itype>vinum ex insula Coo dictum ab agro generoso, cui nomen est Hippo</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=101" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 101</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
hippocrates: <entryFree id="n20731" type="main" key="Hippocra^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hippocrătes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ippokra/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n20731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the celebrated Greek physician of Cos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">founder of the art of medicine</hi>, Cels. praef.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:33:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 33, 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:64" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 64</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20731.1" n="B" level="2"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hippocrătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Hippocrates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Hippocratic</hi>: laniena, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 497.—</sense><sense id="n20731.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Syracusan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brother of Epicydes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36 al" default="NO" valid="yes">36 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
hippocrene: <entryFree id="n20732" type="main" key="Hippocre_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hippocrēnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ippokrh/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n20732.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fountain near Mount Helicon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacred to the Muses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and which is fabled to have been produced by a stroke of Pegasus's hoof</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:7" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 7 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl> (in <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 10</bibl>: fons Pindaricus, and in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:prol. 1" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> prol. 1</bibl>: fons caballinus).—</sense><sense id="n20732.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n20732.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hippocrē-naeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Hippocrene</hi>: fontes, Auct. de Laud. Herc. 5.—</sense><sense id="n20732.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hippocrēnĭdes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Muses so named from the Hippocrene</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 7, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hippodamantium: <entryFree id="n20733" type="hapax" key="hippo^da^manti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hippŏdămantĭum vīnum</orth>, <sense id="n20733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of wine</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 7, 9, § 75</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hippodamas: <entryFree id="n20734" type="main" key="Hippo^da^mas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hippŏdămas</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ippoda/mas</foreign>, <sense id="n20734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the father of Perimele</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:592" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 592</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hippodame: <entryFree id="n20735" type="main" key="Hippo^da^me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hippŏdămē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hippŏdămīa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-mēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ippoda/mh</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*(ippoda/meia</foreign>. <sense id="n20735.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Daughter of Œnomaüs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Elis; she became the wife of Pelops</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who won her in a race with her father</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:12:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 12, 26</bibl> (Trag. v. 398 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:2:20" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:8:35" default="NO">1, 8, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 8, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 7</bibl> Serv.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 243" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 243</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:84" default="NO">84</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20735.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Daughter of Adrastus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and wife of Pirithoüs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at whose wedding took place the battle of the Centaurs and Lapithœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 210</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">224</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 17, 248</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 33" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hippodamus: <entryFree id="n20736" type="greek" key="Hippo^da^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hippŏdămus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ippo/damos</foreign>, <sense id="n20736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the horse-tamer</hi>, a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> epithet of Castor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:57:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 57, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hippodromos: <entryFree id="n20737" type="greek" key="hippodro^mos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hippodrŏmos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(ppo/dromos</foreign>, <sense id="n20737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a race-course for horses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hippodrome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:50:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 50, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ap. 2, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hippolapathon: <entryFree id="n20738" type="greek" key="hippo^la^pa^thon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hippŏlăpăthon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(ppola/paqon</foreign>, <sense id="n20738.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">horse-sorrel</hi>, a plant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 21, 85, § 232</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hippolyte: <entryFree id="n20739" type="main" key="Hippo^ly^te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hippŏlytē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hippŏlyta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ippolu/th</foreign>. <sense id="n20739.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Amazon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Mars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taken captive in the war of the Amazons by Theseus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to whom she bore Hippolytus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 30" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4:23" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 4, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 3, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20739.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The wife of Acastus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Magnesia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who conceived a passion for Peleus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and</hi>, <hi rend="ital">because she met with no return of affection from him</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accused him to her husband of an attempt upon her virtue</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 14 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hippolytus: <entryFree id="n20740" type="main" key="Hippo^ly^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hippŏlytus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ippo/lutos</foreign>, <sense id="n20740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Theseus and Hippolyte; his step-mother Phœdra fell in love with him</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on her advances being repelled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">she accused him to her husband of attempts upon her chastity; the king in his rage cursed him and devoted him to destruction; whereupon he was torn to pieces by his horses; he was</hi>, <hi rend="ital">however</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restored to life by Æsculapius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and taken by Diana</hi>, <hi rend="ital">under the name of Virbius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to the grove near Aricia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where he afterwards received divine honors</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:497 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 497 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 10, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:11:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 11, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:761 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 761 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 7, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 47" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:251" default="NO">251</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hippomanes: <entryFree id="n20741" type="greek" key="hippo^ma^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hippŏmănes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(ppomane/s</foreign> (horse-heat, horse-rage). <sense id="n20741.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A slimy humor that flows from a mare when in heat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and which was used to excite desire</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:280 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 280 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:5:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 5, 18</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:516" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 516</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n20741.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant that was supposed to put mares in heat</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 3, 281</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20741.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small black membrane on the forehead of a new-born foal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">used in making love-potions</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 42, 66, § 165</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:180" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 11, 49, § 180</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:132" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 132</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hippomarathum: <entryFree id="n20742" type="greek" key="hi^ppo^ma^ra^thum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭppŏmărăthum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-on</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(ppoma/raqon</foreign>, <sense id="n20742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">horse-fennel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wild fennel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 23, 96, § 258</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hippomeneis: <entryFree id="n20743" type="main" key="Hippo^me^ne_is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hippŏmĕnēis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ippomenhi/+s</foreign>, <sense id="n20743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Limone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a daughter of Hippomenes of Athens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as a punishment for unchastity</hi>, <pb n="857" /> <cb n="HIRC" /> <hi rend="ital">was thrown by her father to a horse to be devoured</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:337" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 337</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:461" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 461</bibl> (al. Hippomeneia).</sense></entryFree>
hippomenes: <entryFree id="n20744" type="main" key="Hippo^me^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hippŏmĕnes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ippome/nhs</foreign>, <sense id="n20744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Megareus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who conquered Atalanta</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the daughter of Schœneus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in a race</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and thus obtained her as his wife</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:575 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 575 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">632</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 185" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 185</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 3, 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hipponax: <entryFree id="n20745" type="main" key="Hippo_nax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hippōnax</orth>, <itype>actis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ippw/nac</foreign>, <sense id="n20745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek poet of Ephesus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who wrote in iambics</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated for the bitterness of his satires</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:38:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 38, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 12</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n20745.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hippōnactēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Hipponax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the style of Hipponax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Hipponactean</hi>: praeconium, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a bitter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">biting poem</hi> (of Licinius Calvus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 24, 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hippōnacteus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. versus), <hi rend="ital">the sort of iambic verse invented by Hipponax</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senarios et Hipponacteos effugere vix possumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:56:189" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 56, 189</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hipponensis: <entryFree id="n20746" type="main" key="Hippo_nensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hippōnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. Hippo, II. B.</entryFree>
hipponicus: <entryFree id="n20747" type="main" key="Hippo^ni_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hippŏnīcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ippo/nikos</foreign>, <sense id="n20747.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Athenian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father-in-law of Alcibiades</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hippoperae: <entryFree id="n20748" type="greek" key="hippo^pe_rae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hippŏpērae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(ppoph=rai</foreign>, <sense id="n20748.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">saddle-bags</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hippophaes: <entryFree id="n20749" type="main" key="hippo^pha^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hippŏphăes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(ppofae/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi> (perh. the Euphorbia spinosa, Linn.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 15, 54, § 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:29" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 12, 14, § 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hippophaeston: <entryFree id="n20750" type="greek" key="hippo^phaeston"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hippŏphaeston</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(ppo/faiston</foreign>, <sense id="n20750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prickly plant</hi> (perh. Centaurea calcitrapa, Linn.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 10, 66, § 92</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hippopheon: <entryFree id="n20751" type="greek" key="hippophe^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hippophĕon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n20751.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 35, § 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hippophlomon: <entryFree id="n20752" type="greek" key="hippophlo^mon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hippophlŏmon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(ppo/flomon</foreign>, <sense id="n20752.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">white mandrake</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 94, § 148</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hippophobas: <entryFree id="n20753" type="greek" key="hippo^pho^bas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hippŏphŏbas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(ppofoba/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20753.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 102, § 161</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hippopodes: <entryFree id="n20754" type="main" key="Hippo^po^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hippŏpŏdes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ippo/podes</foreign>, <sense id="n20754.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fabulous race of men</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with horses' feet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 13, 27, § 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:6:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 6, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hippopotamus: <entryFree id="n20755" type="greek" key="hippo^po^ta^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hippŏpŏtămus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(ppopo/tamos</foreign>, <sense id="n20755.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river - horse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hippopotamus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 25, 39, § 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:9:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hipposelinum: <entryFree id="n20756" type="greek" key="hippo^se^li_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hippŏsĕlīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(ppose/linon</foreign>, <sense id="n20756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of wild parsley;</hi> lit., <hi rend="ital">horse-parsley</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 37, § 124</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Apr. 3</bibl> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:36" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 36</bibl>, written as Greek, and translated by olus atrum).</sense></entryFree>
hippotades: <entryFree id="n20757" type="main" key="Hippo^ta^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hippŏtădes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ippota/dhs</foreign>, <sense id="n20757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the descendant of Hippotes</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Æŏlus</hi> (as the son of Segesta, a daughter of the Trojan Hippotes), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:663" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 663</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 431</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 224</bibl>: Hippotadae regnum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the Æolic</hi> (Liparic) <hi rend="ital">Isles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 86</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 15, 707</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hippothous: <entryFree id="n20758" type="main" key="Hippo^tho^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hippŏthŏus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Cercyon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who took part in the Calydonian hunt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 306</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hippotoxotae: <entryFree id="n20759" type="greek" key="hippo^toxo^tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hippŏtoxŏtae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(ppotoco/tai</foreign>, <sense id="n20759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mounted archers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 4, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. B. Afr. 19, 6 (pure Lat., equites sagittarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 4</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
hippuris: <entryFree id="n20760" type="greek" key="hippu_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hippūris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(/ppouris</foreign>, <sense id="n20760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">horsetail</hi>, a water-plant; <cit><quote lang="la">pure Lat., equisetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 13, 83, § 132</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hippurus: <entryFree id="n20761" type="greek" key="hippu_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hippūrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(/ppouros</foreign>, <sense id="n20761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fish</hi> (perh. <hi rend="ital">golden carp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gold fish</hi>, Coryphaena hippurus, Linn.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:95" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 16, 24, § 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:149" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 53, § 149</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hippus: <entryFree id="n20762" type="greek" key="hippus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hippus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(/ppos</foreign>, <sense id="n20762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sea-fish</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 149</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hir: <entryFree id="n20763" type="main" key="hir"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hir</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ir</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype> <gen>n.</gen> <etym>from <foreign lang="greek">xei/r</foreign>, like heres from <foreign lang="greek">xh=ros</foreign>, and hiems from <foreign lang="greek">xei=ma, xeimw/n</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n20763.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hand</hi>: quibu' vinum Defusum e pleno siet, ir siphove, cui nil Dempsit, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the palm of the hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">used in tasting wine</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 8, 23</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 12</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 648</bibl> ib.; 698 ib.</sense></entryFree>
hira: <entryFree id="n20764" type="main" key="hi_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hīra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n20764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the empty gut;</hi> called also intestinum jejunum, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">nh=stis</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hircinus: <entryFree id="n20765" type="main" key="hirci_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hircīnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">hirquīnus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hircus</etym>, <sense id="n20765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a goat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">goat's</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">barba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20</bibl></cit> prooem. § 2; <cit><quote lang="la">37, 4, 15, § 59: pelles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 17, 40, § 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the constellation Capricorn</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 621</bibl></cit>.—Comically: <cit><quote lang="la">alae,</quote> <trans><tr>that have a goatish smell</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hircipes: <entryFree id="n20766" type="hapax" key="Hirci^pes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hircĭpes</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>hircus - pes</etym>, <sense id="n20766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">goat-footed</hi>, an appellation of Pan, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 906</bibl>. <cb n="HIRS" /></sense></entryFree>
hirco: <entryFree id="n20767" type="main" key="hirco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hirco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n20767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to howl</hi>, of the sound of the lynx, Auct. Carm. de Philom. 51.</sense></entryFree>
hircosus: <entryFree id="n20768" type="main" key="hirco_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hircōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hircus</etym>, <sense id="n20768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that smells like a goat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">goatish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens centurionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:77" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subulcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:98:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 98, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: licet scripti sint inter hircosos, possint tamen inter unguentatos placere, Sen. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:2:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:59:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 59, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hirculus: <entryFree id="n20769" type="main" key="hircu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hircŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n20769.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little goat</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 86, 16</bibl> (Ps.-Catull. 19, 16). —</sense><sense id="n20769.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 12, 26, § 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hircuosus: <entryFree id="n20770" type="hapax" key="hircu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hircŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">goatish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pan,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 169 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
hircus: <entryFree id="n20771" type="main" key="hircus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hircus</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">hircŭus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ircus</orth>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 20</bibl>; <sense id="n20771.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">and the Sabine form, FIRCUS,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=97" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 97</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. haedus <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>), i, m., <hi rend="ital">a he-goat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">buck</hi> (cf. haedus, caper). </sense><sense id="n20771.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 312</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:34" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 220</bibl> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 4, 15, § 60</bibl>: foedissimum animalium).— </sense><sense id="n20771.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n20771.3" n="A" level="2"> Like caper, <hi rend="ital">a goatish smell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the rank smell of the armpits</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hircum ab alis (sapere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:71:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 71, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an gravis hirsutis cubet hircus in alis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:12:5" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastillos Rufillus olet, Gargonius hircum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 2, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 4, 92</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20771.4" n="B" level="2"> An epithet applied to a filthy person: <cit><quote lang="la">hircus, hara suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter operam illius hirqui improbi edentuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 2, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20771.5" n="C" level="2"> Of voluptuous persons, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:37:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 37, 5</bibl>; Poët. Atell. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hirnea: <entryFree id="n20772" type="main" key="hirne^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hirnĕa</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">irnea</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n20772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a jug</hi> for holding liquids, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 273</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">276</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hirnula: <entryFree id="n20773" type="main" key="hirnu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hirnŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>hirnea</etym>, <sense id="n20773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small jug</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pitcher</hi> for liquids; in an unaspirated form: irnela vasis genus in sacris, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=105" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 105</bibl> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (but urnulas is the true reading in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:2:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 1, 2, 11</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
hirpex: <entryFree id="n20774" type="main" key="hirpex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hirpex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, v. irpex.</entryFree>
hirpi: <entryFree id="n20775" type="main" key="Hirpi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hirpi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very ancient Sabine family near Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the territory of the Falisci</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 2, § 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hirpini: <entryFree id="n20776" type="main" key="Hirpi_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hirpīni</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Irpīni</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20776.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Lower Italy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Campania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Lucania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Apulia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:61:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 61, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:37" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:15" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Hirpinis,</quote> <trans><tr>in the territory of the Hirpini</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 36, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 93, 95, § 208</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ex Hirpinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 13 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Hirpinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20776.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hirpīnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Irp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Hirpini</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager, fundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:571" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 571</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hirpus: <entryFree id="n20777" type="gloss" key="hirpus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hirpus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">irpus</orth>, in the Sabine lang., <sense id="n20777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wolf</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=106:1" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 106, 1</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 11, 785</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hirquinus: <entryFree id="n20778" type="main" key="hirqui_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hirquīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. hircinus.</entryFree>
hirquitallio: <entryFree id="n20779" type="gloss" key="hirquitalli^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hirquitallĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>hircus</etym>, of new - born children, <sense id="n20779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to acquire a strong voice</hi>: in secunda hebdomade vel incipiente tertia vocem crassiorem et inaequabilem fieri: quod Aristoteles appellat <foreign lang="greek">tragi/zein</foreign>, antiqui nostri ‡ <cit><quote lang="la">hirquitallire: et inde ipsos putant ‡ hirquitallos appellari, quod tum corpus hircum olere incipiat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> de Die Nat. 14, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: ‡ hirquitalli pueri primum ad virilitatem accedentes, a libidine scilicet hircorum dicti, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=101" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 101</bibl> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> and without the aspiration: <cit><quote lang="la">‡ irquitallus puer, qui primo virilitatem suam experitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 105</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hirquitallus: <entryFree id="n20780" type="gloss" key="hirquitallus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hirquitallus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <sense id="n20780.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the preced.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
hirquus: <entryFree id="n20781" type="main" key="hirquus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hirquus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. hircus.</entryFree>
hirrio: <entryFree id="n20782" type="main" key="hirri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hirrĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">irrio</orth>), <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, of dogs, <sense id="n20782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to snarl</hi>: hirrire = garrire, quod genus vocis est canis rabiosae, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=101" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 101</bibl> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf.: hirrit <foreign lang="greek">o(/tan ku/wn a)peilh=| u(laktw=n</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.: <cit><quote lang="la">veluti est canibus innatum, ut, etsi non latrant, tamen hirriant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 367</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
hirritus: <entryFree id="n20783" type="hapax" key="hirri_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hirrītus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">irr-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>hirrio</etym>, <sense id="n20783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a snarling</hi> of dogs, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 16</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in carm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
hirsutia: <entryFree id="n20784" type="hapax" key="hirsu_ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hirsūtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>hirsutus</etym>, <sense id="n20784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">roughness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shagginess</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullae setarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 25, § 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hirsutus: <entryFree id="n20785" type="main" key="hirsu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hirsūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>primary form HIRSUS, a variation of hirtus</etym>, <sense id="n20785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shaggy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bristly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prickly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hirsute</hi> = <foreign lang="greek">dasu/s</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n20785.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. hirtus, pilosus, villosus): quarum (animantium) aliae villis vestitae, aliae spinis hirsutae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 121</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:2:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus Herculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 9, 49: <cit><quote lang="la">crura genaeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:65:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 65, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supercilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et glacialis Hiems canos hirsuta capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13</bibl></cit>, <cb n="HISC" /> 766: <cit><quote lang="la">capilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 9, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juba (galeae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 10, 20: <cit><quote lang="la">vellera (leonis) setis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:339" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 339</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castaneae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 53</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">frondes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vepres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 444</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 4, 28: <cit><quote lang="la">folia hirsutiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 33, § 75</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, to designate the people of the olden time (when the hair of the head and beard was left untrimmed), like intonsus and incomptus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:812" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 812</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:48:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 48, 2</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n20785.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">rude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpolished</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumpserit Annales: nihil est hirsutius illis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:259" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 259</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hirticulus: <entryFree id="n20786" type="gloss" key="hirticulus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hirticulus</orth> <foreign lang="greek">dasuprwktos</foreign>, Gloss. Phil.</entryFree>
hirtinus: <entryFree id="n20787" type="main" key="Hirti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hirtīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Hirtius.</entryFree>
hirtipili: <entryFree id="n20788" type="gloss" key="hirtipili"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hirtipili</orth> <itype>durorum pilorum homines</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=101" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 101</bibl> Müll. <sense id="n20788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
hirtius: <entryFree id="n20789" type="main" key="Hirti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hirtĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n20789.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens.; in partic., A. Hirtius, <hi rend="ital">consul</hi> A. U. C. 711, <hi rend="ital">and author of the eighth book of Cœsar's Commentaries on the Gallic war: he fell before Mutina</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 4, 2</bibl>; Q. Cic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 27, 1</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Hirtīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of Hirtius</hi>: proelium, <hi rend="ital">the battle in which Hirtius met his death</hi>, Asin. Pollio ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 33, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hirtuosus: <entryFree id="n20790" type="spur" key="hirtu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hirtŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, false read. in <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 169</bibl>, inst. of hircuosus.</entryFree>
hirtus: <entryFree id="n20791" type="main" key="hirtus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hirtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n20791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hairy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shaggy</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">dasu/s</foreign> (mostly post-Aug.; cf. hirsutus, hispidus, pilosus, villosus, setosus). </sense><sense id="n20791.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">oves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hirto corde quosdam homines nasci proditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 70, § 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora (Scythis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:121" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 386</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 47</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">tunica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">setae in corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:850" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 850</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">comae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa dumis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:13" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. saepes, Col. poët. 10, 27; and: ager spinigeris stirpibus, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 11, 120: <cit><quote lang="la">hirtiora folia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 71</bibl></cit>: aequor, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uneven surface</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 9, 53.—</sense><sense id="n20791.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of character, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpolished</hi>: non tibi parvum Ingenium, non incultum est et turpiter hirtum, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Marius hirtus atque horridus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:11" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 11</bibl></cit> (cf., of Marius sordidum me et incultis moribus aiunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 39</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
hirudo: <entryFree id="n20792" type="main" key="hi^ru_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭrūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (also called sanguisūga), <sense id="n20792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blood-sucker</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 42, § 122</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego me convortam in hirudinem atque exsugebo sanguinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—Fig., of any thing that exhausts, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">aerarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non missura cutem, nisi plena cruoris, hirudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 476</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hirundineus: <entryFree id="n20793" type="main" key="hi^rundi^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭrundĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hirundo</etym>, <sense id="n20793.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to swallows</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">adventus,</quote> <trans><tr>of the swallows</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. the foll. art.</sense></entryFree>
hirundininus: <entryFree id="n20794" type="main" key="hi^rundi^ni_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭrundĭnīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to swallows</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swallows'</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis, fel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 14, 46, § 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:18:20" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 18, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
