hirundo: <entryFree id="n20795" type="main" key="hi^rundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭrundo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (weakened from <foreign lang="greek">xelidw/n</foreign>), <sense id="n20795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a swallow.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20795.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 33, 49, § 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:70" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 24, 34, § 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 377</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:474" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 474</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:853" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 853</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 13</bibl>.—As a term of endearment: <cit><quote lang="la">dic me anaticulam, columbam vel catellum, Hirundinem, monedulam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 104</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid contendat hirundo cycnis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 6</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">certent cycnis ululae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 55</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n20795.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a flying sea - fish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sea - swallow</hi>, Exocoetus volitans s. evolans, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 26, 43, § 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hisco: <entryFree id="n20796" type="main" key="hisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n20796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [hio; whence also hiasco]. </sense><sense id="n20796.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yawn.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20796.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus, ait, hisce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:546" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 546</bibl></cit>; cf.: magnae nunc hiscite terrae, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rima hiscit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">st, tace, aedes hiscunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20796.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to open the mouth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to mutter</hi> (so most freq. and class.): respondebisne ad haec? aut omnino hiscere audebis? * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:43:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 43, 111</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus dictatoriam vim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus praepotentis viros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:26:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 26, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 19, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum non hisceret, ego intercessi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:9:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoties sinit hiscere fluctus, Nominat Alcyonem, Ov M. 11, 566: raris turbatus vocibus hisco,</quote> <trans><tr>speak</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 314</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere jussus Philotas non hiscere audebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:1:9:32" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 1, 9, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid tentaveris umquam hiscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:127" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loquantur, hiscant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 19, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20796.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to speak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relate</hi> any thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): hem vereor, plus quam fas est captivum hiscere, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 120, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 231</bibl></cit>: <pb n="858" /> <cb n="HIST" /> tantum operis nervis hiscere posse meis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 3</bibl> (4, 2), 4 (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen hiare lyra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 31</bibl></cit> (3, 29), 6).</sense></entryFree>
hisdem: <entryFree id="n20797" type="main" key="hisdem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hisdem</orth> (prop. <orth extent="full" lang="la">isdem</orth>), v. idem <sense id="n20797.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
hispalis: <entryFree id="n20798" type="main" key="Hispa^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hispălis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n20798.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of</hi> Hispania Baetica, now <hi rend="ital">Sevilla</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 97, 100, § 219</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">20</bibl>; Asin. Pollio ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 32, 3</bibl>.—In the <hi rend="ital">neut.</hi> form: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hispal</orth>, <itype>ălis</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:392" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 392</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20798.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hispălensis</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hispălĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the city Hispalis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hispalensis conventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>, §§ 7, 11.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hispă-lienses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Hispalis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hispane: <entryFree id="n20799" type="main" key="Hispa_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hispānē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n20799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">after the manner of Spain</hi>, v. Hispani, II. A. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
hispani: <entryFree id="n20800" type="main" key="Hispa_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hispāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Spaniards</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:76 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 76 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n20800.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n20800.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hispānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Spaniards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Spanish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 10, § 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:88:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 88, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tarraco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:104:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 104, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 454</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladio cingi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 10, 5</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hispānē</orth>: Hispane non Romane memoretis loqui me, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 180</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 495 Vahl.).—</sense><sense id="n20800.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hispā-nĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Spaniards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Spain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:3:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:5:1" default="NO">1, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3" default="NO">3</bibl>; 2, 6, 1 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 2, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:108" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 11, 28, § 108</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:37:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 37, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 17, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 55</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">citerior,</quote> <trans><tr>on this side of the Ebro</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulterior,</quote> <trans><tr>beyond it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 39</bibl></cit>.—In apposition: <cit><quote lang="la">in terra Hispania,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:58:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 58, 5</bibl></cit>.—As consisting of two parts, freq. also in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hispāniae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:1:10" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 20, 34, § 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:249" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 26, 40, § 249</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">29, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 97</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">70</bibl> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Carthago nixa duabus Hispaniis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:15:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 15, 34</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n20800.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hispānĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Spain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">existing in Spain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Spanish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Balbus Cornelius non Hispaniensis natus, sed Hispanus,</quote> <trans><tr>not merely born in Spain</tr>, <tr>but a thorough Spaniard</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:51" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12 praef" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12 praef.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestus maritimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:10:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naufragia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 67, 67, § 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spuma argenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 6, 35, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 10, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">casus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 15, 17, § 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoria Caesaris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20800.5" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hispānĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Spanish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spartum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hispellum: <entryFree id="n20801" type="main" key="Hispellum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hispellum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n20801.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Umbria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the foot of the Apennines</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Spello</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 14, 19, § 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:458" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 458</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3885</bibl>. —<orth extent="full" lang="la">Hispellātes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Hispellum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 8, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hispido: <entryFree id="n20802" type="hapax" key="hispi^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hispĭdo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>hispidus</etym>, <sense id="n20802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make bristly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prickly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spinosis fastigiis hispidatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 26</bibl></cit> dub. (al. hispida turgescit).</sense></entryFree>
hispidus: <entryFree id="n20803" type="main" key="hispi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hispĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n20803.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shaggy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hairy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bristly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prickly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20803.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. v. hirtus): facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 10, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">frons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:11" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus Nereïdum squamis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 5, 4, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater (of a shegoat with young),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:58:37" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 58, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 6, 7, § 17</bibl></cit>: agri, i. e. <hi rend="ital">dirty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foul with rain</hi>, = squalidi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eurus procellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:612" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 612</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, per hypallagen: <cit><quote lang="la">sic hispida turpes Proelia villosis ineunt complexibus ursi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:868" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 868</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n20803.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrestis auris ac hispida,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>rude</tr>, <tr>insensible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hispo: <entryFree id="n20804" type="main" key="Hispo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hispo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 65</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:50" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hispulla: <entryFree id="n20805" type="main" key="Hispulla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hispulla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n20805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:74" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:11" default="NO">12, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 19</bibl> tit.</sense></entryFree>
hister: <entryFree id="n20806" type="main" key="Hister1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hister</orth>, <itype>tri</itype> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ister</orth>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/istros</foreign>, <sense id="n20806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the lower part of the Danube</hi> (the upper part, Danubius). </sense><sense id="n20806.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n20806.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">Ponticum simul et Hadriaticum mare et Histrum amnem et Alpes conspici posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbidus et torquens flaventes Hister arenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 350</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stat vetus urbs, ripae vicina binominis Histri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:8:11" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 8, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20806.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp.: Histro fallacior, <hi rend="ital">an epithet applied by Tertullian to Marcion; because the river</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on account of its</hi> <cb n="HIST" /> <hi rend="ital">strong eddies and many mouths</hi>, <hi rend="ital">was dangerous to the navigator</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20806.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">one who dwells on the Danube</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">collo triumphati proculcat Honorius Histri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Honor. 648</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut tibi captivo famulus mittetur ab Histro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:79:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 79, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n20807" type="gloss" key="hister2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hister</orth>, v. histrio <sense id="n20807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
histon: <entryFree id="n20808" type="greek" key="histon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">histon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(stw/n</foreign>, <sense id="n20808.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the place where a loom stands</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a weaving-room</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere institutos histonas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:21" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
historia: <entryFree id="n20809" type="greek" key="histo^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">histŏrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(stori/a</foreign>, <sense id="n20809.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a narrative of past events</hi>, <hi rend="ital">history</hi> (syn.: annales, fasti). </sense><sense id="n20809.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">historia testis temporum, lux veritatis, vita memoriae, magistra vitae, nuntia vetustatis, qua voce alia nisi oratoris immortalitati commendatur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 9, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat enim historia (initio) nihil aliud nisi annalium confectio, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12, 51</bibl></cit> sq.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:2:5 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 2, 5 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. the art. annalis: videtisne, quantum munds sit oratoris historia? ... Nam quis nescit, primam esse historiae legem, ne quid falsi dicere audeat? deinde ne quid veri non audeat? ne qua suspicio gratiae sit in scribendo? ne qua simultatis? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:15:62 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 15, 62 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic generi historia finitima est, in qua et narratur ornate et regio saepe aut pugna describitur: interponuntur etiam contiones et hortationes, sed in his tracta quaedam et fluens expetitur, non haec contorta et acris oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:20:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 20, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est in historia pura et illustri brevitate dulcius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:75:262" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 75, 262</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italici belli et civilis historia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">historia nec institui potest nisi praeparato otio, nec exiguo tempore absolvi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud Herodotum, patrem historiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic (Sallustius) historiae major est auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscura est historia Romana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum historiae cuidam tamquam vanae repugnaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si historiae lectione discipulos instruxerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res memoranda novis annalibus atque recenti historia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:103" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid Graecia mendax audet in historia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:175" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctor historiae Graecae gravissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 11 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sabinus, secutus quosdam historiae scriptores, dicit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:7:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certus Romanae Historiae auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:7:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 7, 6</bibl></cit>.— Prov.: historiam scribere, <hi rend="ital">to inform one's self accurately of any thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to see a thing for one's self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in scirpo nodum quaeris: quin nos hinc domum Redimus, nisi si historiam scripturi sumus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 1, 23</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">simiae improbitatem historiis Graecis mandatam esse demiror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:32:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 32, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concessum est rhetoribus ementiri in historiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:11:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 11, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil in historiis supra Pontificum annales haberemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:4:1" default="NO">12, 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">historiarum scriptor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 49</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">scriptores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:98" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non orationes modo, sed etiam historias legere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 67</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:18:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 18, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuque pedestribus Dices historiis proelia Caesaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 12, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20809.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen.. <hi rend="ital">a narrative</hi>, <hi rend="ital">account</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">story.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20809.3" n="A" level="2"> In abstr.: <cit><quote lang="la">historiam veterem atque antiquam haec mea senectus sustinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid in ea epistula fuit historia dignum, scribe quam primum, ne ignoremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et quia narrationum tres accepimus species: fabulam ... argumentum ... historiam, in qua est gestae rei expositio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxima de nihilo nascitur historia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hactenus historiae: nunc ad tua devehar astra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 119; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">satis historiarum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amarae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 7, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 4, 44</bibl>.—Hence: Naturalis Historia, <hi rend="ital">the title of the encyclopœdical work of Pliny the Elder.</hi>—Historia, <hi rend="ital">a surname of C. Julius Hyginus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 20</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n20809.4" n="B" level="2"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a subject of discourse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu quoque uti fieres nobilis historia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:15:24" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 15, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
historialis: <entryFree id="n20810" type="main" key="histo^ri^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">histŏrĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>historia</etym>, <sense id="n20810.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to history</hi>, <hi rend="ital">historical</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">venerabilis patriarchae Joseph historialis diligentia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>related in sacred history</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
historice: <entryFree id="n20811" type="main" key="histo^ri^ce_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">histŏrĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. historicus <sense id="n20811.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n20812" type="main" key="histo^ri^ce_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">histŏrĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(storikh/</foreign>, <sense id="n20812.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">explanation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interpretation</hi> of an author: finitae quidem sunt partes duae, quas haec professio pollicetur, id est ratio loquendi et <cb n="HIUL" /> enarratio auctorum: <cit><quote lang="la">quarum illam methodicen, hanc historicen vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:9:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
historicus: <entryFree id="n20813" type="greek" key="histo^ri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">histŏrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(storiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20813.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to history</hi>, <hi rend="ital">historical.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20813.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">earum rerum historiam non tam historico quam oratorio genere perscripsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:83:286" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 83, 286</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 9, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:36:124" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 36, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:12:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 12, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prosopopœïae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines litterati et historici,</quote> <trans><tr>versed in history</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: fides, <hi rend="ital">credibility</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 15, 9; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 143, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20813.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">histŏrĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one versed in history</hi> or <hi rend="ital">who makes historical researches; a writer of history</hi>, <hi rend="ital">historian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratores et philosophi et poëtae et historici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:20:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 20, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11" default="NO">11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:9" default="NO">2, 4, 9</bibl>; 10, 2, 21; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 11, 17 et saep.: Pelopidas, magis historicis quam vulgo notus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis dabit historico, quantum daret acta legenti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:104" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 104</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">histŏrĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">historically</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">descriptiones locorum non historice tantum, sed prope poëtice prosequi fas est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Galat. 10, 9, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
historiographus: <entryFree id="n20814" type="greek" key="histo^ri^o^gra^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">histŏrĭŏgrăphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(storiogra/fos</foreign>, <sense id="n20814.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a writer of history</hi>, <hi rend="ital">historiographer</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gord. 11, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 42, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Eccl. Hist. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Galat. 2, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
histri: <entryFree id="n20815" type="main" key="Histri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Histri</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">Istri</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the people of Istria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Istrians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a barbarous Illyrian tribe subdued by the Romans</hi> B. C. 177: <cit><quote lang="la">principes Histrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 19, 23, § 129</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Histrorum gentem originem a Colchis ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:3:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 32, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per Histros Hister emittitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Histria</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Istria</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a country on the eastern shore of the Adriatic Sea</hi>, extending from Trieste to the Sinus Flanaticus: <cit><quote lang="la">Histria ut peninsula excurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 19, 23, § 129</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 55</bibl>.—Derivv. </sense><sense id="n20815.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Histriāni</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Ist-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the people of Istria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 2, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20815.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Histrĭ-cus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Ist-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Istrian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Istria</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:1" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:11" default="NO" valid="yes">11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostrea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 6, 21, § 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20815.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Histrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Istrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">testa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:64:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 64, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
histriculus: <entryFree id="n20816" type="gloss" key="histri^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">histrĭcŭlus</orth> <foreign lang="greek">logopoio/s</foreign>, Gloss. Philox. [<lbl>dim.</lbl> from histrio; cf. the foll. art.].</entryFree>
histricus: <entryFree id="n20817" type="main" key="histri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">histrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hister, histrio</etym>, <sense id="n20817.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to stage-players</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperator histricus,</quote> <trans><tr>the manager</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <trans><tr>the management</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
histrio: <entryFree id="n20818" type="main" key="histrio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">histrio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Etrusc. prim. form HISTER, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:4:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 4, 4</bibl>; whence histricus and histriculus</etym>, <sense id="n20818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stage-player</hi>, <hi rend="ital">actor</hi>, either tragic or comic (syn.: actor, mimus, tragoedus, comoedus). </sense><sense id="n20818.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod verbum in cavea dixit histrio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:4:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 7, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:3:2:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 3, 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 5, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 61, 258</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 19, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 69</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">77</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. prol. 13</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex pessimo histrione bonum comoedum fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 10, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vidi ego saepe histriones atque comoedos, cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 35</bibl></cit> Spald.: <cit><quote lang="la">patina Aesopi tragoediarum histrionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 46, § 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Ofilius Hilarus comoediarum histrio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 53, 54, § 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tragicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 51, 72, § 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod non dant proceres dabit histrio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:90" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 90</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n20818.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a boaster</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">histrionis est parvam rem attollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
histrionalis: <entryFree id="n20819" type="main" key="histri^o_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">histrĭōnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>histrio</etym>, <sense id="n20819.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a stage-player</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like an actor</hi> (a word of Tac.): <cit><quote lang="la">studium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">favor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
histrionia: <entryFree id="n20820" type="main" key="histri^o_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">histrĭōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. ars) [id.], <sense id="n20820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the art of stage-playing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dramatic art</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere histrioniam,</quote> <trans><tr>to assume the character of an actor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 10, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> Fr. 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
histrionicus: <entryFree id="n20821" type="main" key="histri^o_ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">histrĭōnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20821.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a player</hi>, <hi rend="ital">histrionic</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">operae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:73" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gestus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 18</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">histrĭōnĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the player's art</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 12, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
histrix: <entryFree id="n20822" type="main" key="histrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">histrix</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, v. hystrix.</entryFree>
hiulce: <entryFree id="n20823" type="main" key="hi^ulce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭulcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. hiulcus <sense id="n20823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
hiulco: <entryFree id="n20824" type="main" key="hi^ulco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭulco</orth>, no <sense id="n20824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>hiulcus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to cause to gape</hi> or <hi rend="ital">split open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to break into chinks</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum gravis exustos aestus hiulcat agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per hiulcatos agros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fortun.</author> Carm. 6, 12, 6</bibl></cit>. <pb n="859" /> <cb n="HODI" /></sense></entryFree>
hiulcus: <entryFree id="n20825" type="main" key="hi^ulcus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hĭulcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hio</etym>, <sense id="n20825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gaping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">split</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cleft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">open.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20825.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi hiulca siti findit Canis aestifer arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 353</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aegyptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:708" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 708</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venae fluminis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 450</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juga montis Tauri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes, Claud. Cons. Prob. et Olybr. 206: nimbi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ova,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Hon. 4 praef.</bibl></cit>: mucro, i. e. ungues ferrei, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 452: <cit><quote lang="la">ictus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 113</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n20825.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf., <hi rend="ital">act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cleaving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:26" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20825.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n20825.4" n="A" level="2"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">gaping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not well connected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forming a hiatus</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">struere verba sic, ut neve asper eorum concursus neve hiulcus sit, sed quodammodo coagmentatus et levis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:43:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 43, 171</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hiulcae voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:44:150" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 44, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonnumquam hiulca etiam decent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 36</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n20825.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Eager</hi>, <hi rend="ital">longing</hi> for any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hiulcē</orth> (acc. to II. A.), of speech, <hi rend="ital">in a gaping manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a hiatus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non aspere, non vaste, non rustice, non hiulce, sed presse et aequabiliter et leniter (loqui),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:12:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 12, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ho: <entryFree id="n20826" type="main" key="ho!"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ho!</orth> <pos>interj.</pos>, an expression of astonishment, <sense id="n20826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">oh!</hi> ho! tune is eras? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 52</bibl> dub. (al. oh!).</sense></entryFree>
hoc: <entryFree id="n20827" type="main" key="hoc1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hoc</orth>, <case>abl.</case> and <sense id="n20827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> of hic, q. v.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n20828" type="main" key="hoc2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hoc</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. huc.</entryFree>
hodie: <entryFree id="n20829" type="main" key="ho^di^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏdĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>contr. from hoc die, on this day</etym>, <sense id="n20829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to-day.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20829.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem quidem negat Eros hodie: cras mane putat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 30, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. cras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hodie mane,</quote> <trans><tr>this morning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hodie cum diluculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hodie numquam ad vesperum vivam!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pridie Vinalia, qui dies hodie est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nonae sunt hodie Sextiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:10:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hodie tricesima sabbata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem te, nisi nunc, hodie nusquam vidi gentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego hodie compendi feci binos panes in dies: Ita mea ancilla, quae fuit hodie, sua nunc est: Jam hodie alienum cenabit, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>till today</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:2 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 2 sq.</bibl></cit>: faciam hodie, ut, etc., * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:91:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 91, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si cenas hodie mecum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 70</bibl></cit>.—Of the nighttime: <cit><quote lang="la">illa nocte aliquis, tollens ad sidera vultum, Dicet: Ubi est hodie, quae Lyra fulsit heri?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:76" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 76</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20829.2" n="B" level="2"> Pleon. (freq. in Plaut.): <cit><quote lang="la">maximo hercle hodie malo vostro istunc fertis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ego hodie raso capite calvos capiam pileum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20829.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to - day</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the present day</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at this time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">now</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in these times</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnes, qui tum eos agros, ubi hodie est haec urbs, incolebant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod retinemus hodie,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi non minori curae est, qualis res publica post mortem meam futura sit, quam qualis hodie sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 12, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hodie omnes sic habent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:25:section=64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 25, § 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec turba deorum talis (erat) ut est hodie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:47" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt summa hodie, quibus illustratur forum, ingenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:122" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 122</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt et hodie clari ejusdem operis auctores, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:2:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 2, 21</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: sunt clari hodieque et qui olim nominabuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 94</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">hodieque = et hodie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:22:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 22, 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:16:43 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 16, 43 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but in the post-Aug. per. freq. hodieque for hodie quoque: hodie etiam, usque adhuc, etiam nunc,</quote> <trans><tr>to this day</tr>, <tr>still</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:4:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:8:3" default="NO">2, 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:27:5" default="NO">2, 27, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 45, 70, § 176</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 1, 1, § 2</bibl>; v. que.—</sense><sense id="n20829.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To-day</hi>, <hi rend="ital">now</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at once</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immediately</hi> (cf. <foreign lang="greek">th/meron</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">hodie itura,</quote> <trans><tr>on the point of going</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin agitis hodie? ... Properate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non dices hodie, quorsum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si hodie postulem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,006:23:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Tull. 23, 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hodiernus: <entryFree id="n20830" type="main" key="ho^di^ernus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏdĭernus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hodie</etym>, <sense id="n20830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of this day</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to-day's.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20830.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ex hodierno ejus edicto perspicere potestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 4, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disputatio hesterni et hodierni diei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:21:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 21, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hodierno die, mane,</quote> <trans><tr>today</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante hodiernum diem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis scit an adiciant hodiernae crastina summae Tempora di superi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Servio Tullio regnante) multo diutius Athenae jam erant quam est Roma ad hodiernum diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:10:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 10, 39</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> for hodie: <cit><quote lang="la">sic venias, hodierne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:53" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20830.2" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to hodie, II.) <hi rend="ital">Of the</hi> <cb n="HOLU" /> <hi rend="ital">present time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">present</hi>, <hi rend="ital">actual</hi> (rare and postAug.; cf. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 524 sq.).— Only in <hi rend="ital">neutr. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servatumque in hodiernum est, ne quis, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>to this day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 7, § 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hodiernum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> Octav. 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Dict. Cret.</author> 3, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hodiernum diem,</quote> <trans><tr>to the present time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Cons. Evang. 3:24:69" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Cons. Evang. 3, 24, 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hodoedocos: <entryFree id="n20831" type="gloss" key="ho^doedo^cos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏdoedŏcos</orth> <itype>latro atque obsessor viarum</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=103" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 103</bibl> Müll. [= <foreign lang="greek">o/doido/kos</foreign>].</entryFree>
hodoeporicon: <entryFree id="n20832" type="greek" key="ho^doepo^ri^con"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏdoepŏrĭcon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o/doiporiko/n</foreign>, <sense id="n20832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an itinerary</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 108, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hoedus: <entryFree id="n20833" type="main" key="hoedus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hoedus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, and its derivv., v. haed.</entryFree>
holce: <entryFree id="n20834" type="greek" key="holce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">holcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o(lkh/</foreign>, <sense id="n20834.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drachma</hi>: holceque a drachma non re sed nomine differt, Fann. de Pond. 19.</sense></entryFree>

Th. 10, 21, 3.</sense></entryFree>
holus: <entryFree id="n20853" type="main" key="ho^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏlus</orth> (better than <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlus</orth>; archaic <orth extent="full" lang="la">he-lus</orth>; cf.: helus et helusa antiqui dicebant, quod nunc holus et holera, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=100" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 100</bibl> Müll. A form, holu, anciently helu, can be inferred from helvola, helvella, and olvatum; v. Müll. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=203" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 203</bibl>, b), ĕris (<sense id="n20853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> holerorum for holerum, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 490, 25</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">dat. plur.</hi> holeris for holeribus, Cato, R. R.), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. haris, green; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xlo/h</foreign>; cf.: helvus. helvola, Helvius; O. H. Germ. grucni; Germ. grün; Engl. green, etc.</etym>. </sense><sense id="n20853.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Kitchen</hi> or <hi rend="ital">garden herbs</hi> of any kind; <hi rend="ital">vegetables</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">cabbage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">colewort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turnips</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greens</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:22" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 130</bibl>: pomum, holus, ficum, uvam, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 16</bibl>: donec<cb n="HOMO" />  Discoqueretur holus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prandere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvestre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 38, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marinum,</quote> <trans><tr>sea-cale</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 4, 25, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper holus metimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:2:74" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 2, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Syria in hortis operosissima, venitque in proverbium Graecis, multa Syrorum holera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 5, 16, § 33</bibl></cit>.—Prov. for <hi rend="ital">a coarse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">humble meal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plain diet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">melius est vocari ad olera cum caritate quam ad vitulum saginatum cum odio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:16:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 16, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui infirmus est olus manducet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Rom. 14, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20853.2" n="II" level="1"> Holus atrum, also joined into one word, holusatrum (in <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> holeris atri and holusatri), <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, called also Smyrnium holusatrum, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:7:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 48, § 162</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 12, 62, § 187</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also: holus pullum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:123" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 123</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

Homerus.</entryFree>
homerocento: <entryFree id="n20858" type="main" key="Ho^me_ro^cento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hŏmērŏcento</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Homeruscento</etym>, <sense id="n20858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a poem made up of verses from Homer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> de Praescr. 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 103, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
homeromastix: <entryFree id="n20859" type="greek" key="Ho^me_ro^mastix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hŏmērŏmastix</orth>, <itype>īgis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(omhroma/stic</foreign> (Homer's scourge), <sense id="n20859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the censurer of Homer.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20859.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, an epithet given to the critic Zoilus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7 praef.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n20859.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a censorious person</hi>: ut obiter caveam istos Homeromastigas, etc., Plin. H. N. praef. § 28.</sense></entryFree>
homeronides: <entryFree id="n20860" type="main" key="Ho^me_ro^ni^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hŏmērŏnĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20860.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art. II. E.</sense></entryFree>
homerus: <entryFree id="n20861" type="main" key="Ho^me_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hŏmērus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(/omhros</foreign>, <sense id="n20861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Greek poet Homer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 32, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:10:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 10, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 8, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:34:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 34, 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:5:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:47 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 47 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:359 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 359 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n20861.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n20861.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hŏmērĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(omhriko/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Homer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Homeric</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:25:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 25, 52</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">dispositio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facultas eloquendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">more,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 10, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ajax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:39:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 39, 82</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Agamemno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:26:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 26, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Nestor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>blind</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 2</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n20861.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hŏmērĭă-cus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">notae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 69</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n20861.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hŏmērĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">scyphi, quos Homerios a caelatura carminum Homeri vocabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20861.5" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hŏmērista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(omhristh/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a Homeric rhapsodist</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 481</bibl> P.—* </sense><sense id="n20861.6" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hŏmērŏnĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an imitator of Homer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
homicida: <entryFree id="n20862" type="main" key="ho^mi^ci_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏmĭcīda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>homo-caedo</etym>, <sense id="n20862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a man-slayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">homicide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a murderer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">murderess</hi> (syn.: interfector, sicarius, percussor). </sense><sense id="n20862.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuendum tibi esse, utrum illi, qui istam rem gesserunt, homicidaene sint, an vindices libertatis ... Confiteor eos plus quam sicarios, plus quam homicidas, plus etiam quam parricidas esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:12:30 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 12, 30 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:26" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">an, qui se interficit, homicida sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandatores caedis perinde ut homicidae puniuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 23, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui, cum vellet occidere, id casu aliquo perpetrare non potuit, ut homicida punitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 23, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 3, 194</bibl>.—Of a woman: <cit><quote lang="la">quid si tantum homicida? quid si tantum rea fuisses?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n20862.2" n="II" level="1"> In a good sense, as a transl. of the Homeric <foreign lang="greek">a)ndrofo/nos</foreign>, an epithet of Hector, <hi rend="ital">slayer of men</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:12" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
homicidalis: <entryFree id="n20863" type="main" key="ho^mi^ci_da_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏmĭcīdālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>homicida</etym>, <sense id="n20863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">homicidal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">murderous</hi> (late Lat.), Pseudo-Hilar. in Job, 1, p. 101.</sense></entryFree>
homicidarius: <entryFree id="n20864" type="hapax" key="ho^mi^ci_da_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏmĭcīdārĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏmŏcīdĭā-rĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>homicida and homicidium</etym>, <sense id="n20864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to man-slaying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">homicidal</hi>: sanguis, Auct. Pan. ad Const. 4.</sense></entryFree>
homicidium: <entryFree id="n20865" type="main" key="ho^mi^ci_di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏmĭcīdĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>homicida</etym>, <sense id="n20865.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">manslaughter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">homicide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">murder</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">si quis homicidii accusetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:10:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:52" default="NO">4, 2, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:59" default="NO">11, 3, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 3, § 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
homo: <entryFree id="n20866" type="main" key="ho^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏmo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype> (archaic form hemonem hominem dicebant, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=100" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 100</bibl> Müll.; cf. humanus <sense id="n20866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi>, and nēmo, from nĕ-hĕmo: homōnem, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 683</bibl> P. = <pb n="860" /> <cb n="HOMO" /> Ann. v. 141 Vahl.: <cit><quote lang="la">hŏmōnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:1:1" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>), <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>root in humus, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xamai/</foreign>; cf. Germ. -gam in Bräutigam; O. H. Germ. gomo; Goth. guma; Old Engl. goom; Engl. groom; cf. also Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)pixqo/nioi</foreign>; Hebr. Adam</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a human being</hi>, <hi rend="ital">man.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20866.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n20866.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">animal hoc providum, sagax, multiplex, acutum, memor, plenum rationis et consilii quem vocamus hominem, praeclara quadam condicione generatum esse a summo deo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:7:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 7, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, on the natural history of man,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7 praef.</bibl></cit> sq.; § 5 sq.: decem hominibus vitam eripis, indictā causā, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:25" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 25</bibl> (24), 12: dum quidem unus homo Romanus toga superescit, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=302" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 302</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 486 Vahl.); cf.: unus homo nobis cunctando restituit rem, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 313 ib.): navus repertus homo Graio patre Graius homo rex, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=169" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 169</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 183 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">homo jam grandior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo amicus nobis ... homo antiqua virtute ac fide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:86 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 86 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus homo et nobis amicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: quid est, quod homo masculus lubentius videre debeat bella uxore? Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 248, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">infelix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo omni doctrina eruditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">homo summā prudentiā, multā etiam doctrinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de hujus hominis (i. e. Pompei) felicitate, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp.
