Pomp. 16, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iners atque inutilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:6:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 6, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">contemptus et abjectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:34:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 34, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insulsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:8:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 8, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: hominum homo stultissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid hoc homine faciatis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:16:section=42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 16, § 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulere generi hominum,</quote> <trans><tr>the human race</tr>, <tr>mankind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus hominum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 9, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 7</bibl> et saep. (more freq., genus humanum; v. humanus and genus); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">natura hominem conciliat homini ... hominum coetus et celebrationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placet Stoicis, quae in terris gignantur, ad usum hominum omnia creari, homines autem hominum causa esse generatos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines plurimum hominibus et prosunt et obsunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: is dictus popularibus olim, Qui tum vivebant homines, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:15:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 15, 58</bibl> (Ann. v. 308 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">homines Romani,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 14, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lege conciliati homines cum dis putandi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:7:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro deum atque hominum fidem!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 3, 16</bibl></cit> et saep.: divumque hominumque pater, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=65" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 65</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 566 Vahl.); so, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 567) and ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 254); but homo, <number>sing.</number>, is used of <hi rend="ital">the human race</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mankind</hi> (= homines, genus humanum), when it has no predicate joined with it: <cit><quote lang="la">qua haud scio an quidquam melius sit homini datum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:6:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 6, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">taces, Monstrum hominis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">odium illud hominis impuri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid hoc sit hominis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid illuc hominus est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in addresses: nisi caves tu homo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 5, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu homo adigis me ad insaniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 31</bibl></cit>.—In apposition: <cit><quote lang="la">mares homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amanti homini adulescenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 94</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">filius homo adulescens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 52</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. adulescens: verberare hominem senem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servom hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi hominis histrionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:46:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 46, 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut homo nemo velit nisi hominis similis esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:28:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 28, 78</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. nemo. —Of females: mater, cujus ea stultitia est, ut eam nemo hominem appellare possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:70:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 70, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (Io) bos ex homine est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:620" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 620</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:284" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 284</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcissimum ab hominis camelinum lac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 33, § 123</bibl></cit>: homines feminae (opp. mares homines), Aug. Civ. Dei, 3, 3.—</sense><sense id="n20866.3" n="2" level="3"> Prov. </sense><sense id="n20866.4" n="a" level="4"> Quot homines, tot sententiae, <hi rend="ital">many men</hi>, <hi rend="ital">many minds</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">every one has his own opinion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:5:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 5, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20866.5" n="b" level="4"> Ut homo est, ita morem geras, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 77</bibl> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 36</bibl> spurious, v. Ritschl ad h. l.).—</sense><sense id="n20866.6" n="c" level="4"> Homines, dum docent, discunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 7:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 7, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n20866.7" n="d" level="4"> Aiunt homines plus in alieno negotio videre quam in suo, <hi rend="ital">the lookers-on see farther in the game than the players</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 109:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 109, 16</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n20866.8" n="e" level="4"> Homo nulli coloris, <hi rend="ital">neither fish nor flesh</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 99</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20866.9" n="f" level="4"> Homo sum; humani nihil a me alienum puto, Ter. Heaut. <cb n="HOMO" /> 1, 1, 25; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">homo ego sum, homo tu es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20866.10" n="g" level="4"> Lupus homo homini, non homo, quom qualis sit non novit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 88</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20866.11" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n20866.12" n="1" level="3"> Pregn., in a good or a bad sense. </sense><sense id="n20866.13" n="a" level="4"> In a good sense (cf. vir), <hi rend="ital">a man</hi>, as a reasonable or moral being: <cit><quote lang="la">homo es, qui me emunxisti mucidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si homo esset, eum potius legeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox te expolivit hominemque reddidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:10:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 10, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si vis homo esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines visi sumus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 52, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos quod simus, quod habeamus, quod homines existimemur, id omne abs te habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tu sis homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et tu illum tuom, si esses homo, sineres, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>if you had a man's sense</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exuens hominem ex homine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:12:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 12, 35</bibl></cit>: cum Socrates Alcibiadi persuasisset, eum nihil hominis esse, <hi rend="ital">that he was nothing of a man</hi> (i. e. <hi rend="ital">in no respect such as a man should be</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:32:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 32, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Nero) dicebat se quasi hominem tandem habitare coepisse,</quote> <trans><tr>like a human being</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me hominem inter homines voluit esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 39</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n20866.14" n="b" level="4"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">a man</hi>, as a weak, mortal being, subject to error, of low condition (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">fateor me saepe peccasse, nam et homo sum et adhuc juvenis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 130</bibl></cit>: cf. <cit><quote lang="la">homines sumus, non dei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Demosthenes, Homerus) summi sunt, homines tamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 25</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: quae si hoc tempore non diem suum obiisset, paucis post annis tamen ei moriendum fuit, quoniam homo nata fuerat, Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 4</bibl>.—Also of servants (as distinguished from a free Roman): homo P. Quinti, <hi rend="ital">Quintus's man</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">his slave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">servant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 19, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum familiae ... Saturnalibus et Compitalibus in singulos homines congios,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 57, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:10:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 10, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20866.15" n="2" level="3"> In opp. to a woman, <hi rend="ital">a man</hi> (anteand post-class., and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">mi homo et mea mulier, vos saluto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:38" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 38</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n20866.16" n="3" level="3"> In milit. lang., homines, opp. to cavalry, <hi rend="ital">foot-soldiers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infantry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capti homines equitesque producebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:39:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 39, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. vir. —</sense><sense id="n20866.17" n="4" level="3"> Homo novus, v. novus.—</sense><sense id="n20866.18" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Bodies</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corpses</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam pigritia singulos sepeliendi promisce acervatos cumulos hominum urebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:48:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 48, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20866.19" n="6" level="3"> Particular phrases. </sense><sense id="n20866.20" n="a" level="4"> Paucorum hominum esse, <hi rend="ital">to have but few intimates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be choice in one's company</hi>: (Maecenas) paucorum hominum et mentis bene sanae. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo est Perpaucorum hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 19</bibl></cit>.— Hence, comically, of the favorite but rare fish, acipenser: Scipio vide, quid agas: acipenser iste paucorum hominum est, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 12</bibl> (see the anecdote in connection).—</sense><sense id="n20866.21" n="b" level="4"> Inter homines esse (agere). </sense><sense id="n20866.22" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To be among the living</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be alive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to live</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Hercules numquam abiisset ad deos, nisi cum inter homines esset, eam sibi viam munivisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:14:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter homines esse desinere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to die</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:1:59" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 31, 1, 59</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">agere inter homines desinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 74 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab hominibus ereptus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:1:58" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 31, 1, 58</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n20866.23" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To see the world</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be among men</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iste homo qui numquam inter homines fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:28:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 28, 76</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20866.24" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, esp. in familiar lang., <hi rend="ital">the man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the fellow</hi>, instead of the pron. <hi rend="ital">he</hi>, <hi rend="ital">his</hi>, <hi rend="ital">him</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haben argentum ab homine?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi homo coepit me obsecrare, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itast homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixit, se senatui roganti de Marcello ne hominis quidem causa negaturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei medico imperasti, ut venas hominis incideret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:34:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 34, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum esse in homine sceleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 9, 22</bibl></cit> Halm.; 41, 89; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:27:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 27, § 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">persuasit homini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut insanit homo aut versus facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agnoscit hominem Caesar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 5, 19</bibl></cit> Burm. ad loc.; al.—</sense><sense id="n20866.25" n="B" level="2"> Hic homo, <hi rend="ital">this man</hi>, = <hi rend="ital">I</hi>, <hi rend="ital">myself</hi> (ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">hunc hominem velles si tradere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solus hic homo est, qui sciat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi verba, huic homini verbera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:2:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 2, 114</bibl></cit> (cf. hic, G.).</sense></entryFree>
homocidalis: <entryFree id="n20867" type="main" key="ho^mo^ci_da_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏmŏcīdālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>homo-caedo</etym>, <sense id="n20867.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">murderous</hi>: animus suus, Anon. (Hilar.) in Job, 1, p. 101.</sense></entryFree>
homoeomeria: <entryFree id="n20868" type="greek" key="ho^moeo^me^ri_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏmoeŏmĕrīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o(moiome/reia</foreign>; in the philosophy of Anaxagoras, <sense id="n20868.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the</hi> <cb n="HONE" /> <hi rend="ital">homogeneousness of the elements</hi> or <hi rend="ital">first principles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:830" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 830</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 4, 625</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
homoeopropheron: <entryFree id="n20869" type="greek" key="ho^moeo^pro^phe^ron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏmoeŏprŏphĕron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o(moiopro/feron</foreign>, <sense id="n20869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">alliteration</hi>, as in the verse of Ennius (ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 947</bibl> P. = Ann. v. 113 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">o Tite tute Tati tibi tanta tyranne tulisti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 514</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
homoeoptoton: <entryFree id="n20870" type="greek" key="ho^moeopto_ton"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏmoeoptōton</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o(moio/ptwton</foreign>, <sense id="n20870.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">similar case-endings</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 532</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 251</bibl> P.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:78" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 78</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
homoeoteleuton: <entryFree id="n20871" type="greek" key="ho^moeo^te^leuton"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏmoeŏtĕleuton</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o(moiote/leuton</foreign>, <sense id="n20871.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like ending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rhyme</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 532</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 251</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
homole: <entryFree id="n20872" type="main" key="Ho^mo^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hŏmŏlē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(omo/lh</foreign>, <sense id="n20872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a high mountain in Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Tempe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:675" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 675</bibl>.—At the foot of it was the city <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hŏmŏlĭum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 9, 16, § 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:38:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 38, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20872.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hŏmŏlōĭ-des</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. portae), = <foreign lang="greek">*(omolwi/des pu/lai</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the Homoloian gate in Thebes</hi> (so named from the Cadmeans, who came from Mount Homole), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:252" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 252</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
homologus: <entryFree id="n20873" type="greek" key="ho^mo^lo^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏmŏlŏgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o(mo/logos</foreign>, <sense id="n20873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a later colonist</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Theod.</author> 11, 24, 6, § 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
homolois: <entryFree id="n20874" type="main" key="Ho^mo^lo_is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hŏmŏlōis</orth>, <itype>idos</itype>, v. Homole, II.</entryFree>
homonymia: <entryFree id="n20875" type="greek" key="ho^mo_ny^mi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏmōnymĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o(mwnumi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n20875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">homonymy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Diff. Verb. p. 353" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Diff. Verb. p. 353</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
homonymus: <entryFree id="n20876" type="gloss" key="ho^mo_ny^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏmōnymus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">o(mw/numos</foreign>, <sense id="n20876.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the same name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">homonymous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut in his, quae homonyma vocantur: ut, Taurus animal sit, an mons, an signum in caelo, an nomen hominis, an radix arboris, nisi distinctum non intelligitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
homotonus: <entryFree id="n20877" type="greek" key="ho^mo^to^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏmŏtŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">o(mo/tonos</foreign>, <sense id="n20877.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stretched alike</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in unison</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervi, funes, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
homousius: <entryFree id="n20878" type="greek" key="ho^mo^u_sius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏmŏūsius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">o(moou/sios</foreign>, <sense id="n20878.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of like substance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consubstantial</hi> (Lat. consubstantialis): <cit><quote lang="la">Trinitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 77, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
homullulus: <entryFree id="n20879" type="gloss" key="ho^mullu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏmullŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>homullus</etym>, <sense id="n20879.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a manikin</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 614</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
homullus: <entryFree id="n20880" type="main" key="ho^mullus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏmullus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>homo</etym>, <sense id="n20880.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manikin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevis hic est fructus homullis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:914" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 914</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid cessat hic homullus, ex argilla et luto fictus Epicurus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:25:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 25, 59</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
homuncio: <entryFree id="n20881" type="main" key="ho^munci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏmuncĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manikin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego homuncio hoc non facerem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homuncio hic, qui multa putat praeter virtutem homini cara esse (opp. deus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 43, 134</bibl></cit>: (Augustus Horatium) inter alios jocos homuncionem lepidissimum appellat, Suet. Vit. Hor.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 116:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 116, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadringenta tibi si quis deus aut similis dis homuncio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:133" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 133</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
homuncionitae: <entryFree id="n20882" type="main" key="ho^munci^o_ni_tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏmuncĭōnītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>homuncio</etym>, <sense id="n20882.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Christian sect who considered Jesus as man only</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 552</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
homunculus: <entryFree id="n20883" type="main" key="ho^muncu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏmuncŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>homo</etym>, <sense id="n20883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little</hi> or <hi rend="ital">weakly man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a manikin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hui, Homunculi quanti estis!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. prol. 51</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 90</bibl>: hem! nos homunculi indignamur, si quis, etc., Sulpic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque tam desipiens fuisset, ut homunculis similem deum fingeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:44:123" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 44, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut homunculus unus e multis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:9:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 9, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">humilis homunculus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 23, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 222</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
honestamentum: <entryFree id="n20884" type="main" key="ho^nesta_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏnestāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>honesto</etym>, <sense id="n20884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ornament</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grace</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): nullo honestamento eget virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66, 2</bibl></cit>.— In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia honestamenta pacis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Or. ad Caes. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Or. ad Caes. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 276</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:26:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 26, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Theod.</author> 12, 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
honestas: <entryFree id="n20885" type="main" key="ho^nestas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏnestas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>honestus</etym>, <sense id="n20885.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">honorableness.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20885.1" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to honestus, I.) <hi rend="ital">Honorable consideration</hi> which a man enjoys, <hi rend="ital">honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reputation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">character</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respectability</hi>, <hi rend="ital">credit</hi>, opp. to turpitudo (class.; cf.: existimatio, dignitas). </sense><sense id="n20885.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: quid est honestas nisi honor perpetuus ad aliquem secundo populi rumore delatus. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 8</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde pudor, continentia, fuga turpitudinis, appetentia laudis et honestatis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fugiendae turpitudinis adipiscendaeque honestatis causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:27:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 27, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:3:23 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 3, 23 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil esse in vita magnopere expetendum nisi laudem atque honestatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 6, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia, quae putant homines expetenda, honestas, gloria, tranquillitas animi atque jucunditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:22:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 22, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 5, 14</bibl>: cogita, ea nobis erepta esse, quae hominibus<pb n="861" /> <cb n="HONE" />  non minus quam liberi cara esse debent, honestatem, dignitatem, honores omnes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas familias honestatis amplitudinisque gratia nomino,</quote> <trans><tr>on account of their character</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestate spoliatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:16:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 16, 44</bibl></cit>; cf.: omni jure atque honestate interdictus, Q. Metell. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fautor infimi generis hominum, odio alienae honestatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:47:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 47, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestatem omnem amittere,</quote> <trans><tr>consideration</tr>, <tr>respect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:39:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 39, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eoque (officio) et colendo sita vitae est honestas omnis et in negligendo turpitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:3:24" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 3, 24</bibl>: honestati alicujus convenire (with <hi rend="ital">subj. clause</hi>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 5, 2</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number> (= honores): <cit><quote lang="la">ceteris ante partis honestatibus atque omni dignitate fortunaque aliquem privare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:40:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 40, 87</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20885.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr.: <cit><quote lang="la">causa, in qua omnes honestates civitatis, omnes aetates, omnes ordines una consentiunt,</quote> <trans><tr>honorable</tr>, <tr>reputable persons</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:51:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 51, 109</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n20885.4" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to honestus, II.) </sense><sense id="n20885.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Honorableness</hi> of character, <hi rend="ital">honorable feeling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honesty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">probity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">integrity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virtue</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi est autem dignitas, nisi ubi honestas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo est inventus tam perditus, tam ab omni non modo honestate sed etiam simulatione honestatis relictus, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 8, 23</bibl></cit> and 24: <cit><quote lang="la">(qui summum bonum) suis commodis, non honestate metitur ... honestatem propter se expetere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit> and 6; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnis honestas manet a partibus quatuor, quarum, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 43, 152</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">habes undique expletam et perfectam formam honestatis, quae tota his quatuor virtutibus continetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:15:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 15, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et in laude justitia utilitasque tractantur, et in consiliis honestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: sunt qui tradant tanta eum (Staberium Erotem) honestate praeditum, ut, etc., <hi rend="ital">such an honorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noble character;</hi> Fr. <hi rend="ital">honnēteté</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod factum causā publicae honestatis vindictam exspectat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 4, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20885.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things, <hi rend="ital">beauty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grace</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">testudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:1:section=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si est honestas in rebus ipsis, de quibus dicitur, exsistit ex rei natura quidam splendor in verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:31:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 31, 125</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
honeste: <entryFree id="n20886" type="main" key="ho^neste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏnestē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. honestus <sense id="n20886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
honestitudo: <entryFree id="n20887" type="main" key="ho^nesti^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏnestĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>honestus</etym>, <sense id="n20887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">honorableness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virtue</hi> (ante-class. for honestas, II.): tua honestitudo Danaos decipit diu, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 121, 1</bibl> (Trag. Fr. v. 501 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">horrida Europae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 120, 31</bibl></cit> (Fragm. Tr. v. 16 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
honesto: <entryFree id="n20888" type="main" key="ho^nesto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏnesto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to clothe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adorn with honor; to honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dignify; to adorn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embellish</hi> (class.; cf. honoro), with personal or inanimate objects. </sense><sense id="n20888.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">With personal objects</hi> quom me tanto honore honestas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 106</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 50</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod non dignos homines honore honestatos videbam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 35:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 35, 3</bibl></cit> Kritz.: <cit><quote lang="la">tantam laudem, quantā vos me vestris decretis honestatis, nemo est assecutus, Cic Cat 4, 10, 20: Saturnini imagine mortem ejus honestare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Rab. Perd. 9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 9, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Sull. 29:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 29, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Off. 1:39:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 39, 139</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec famigeratio Te honestet, me autem collutulet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eum augendum atque honestandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:6:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quibus, si interdum ad forum deducimur, si uno basilicae spatio honestamur, diligenter observari videmur et coli,</quote> <trans><tr>are honored by being accompanied through the basilica</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:34:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 34, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summi viri Gracchorum et Flacci sanguine non modo se non contaminarunt, sed etiam honestarunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem vultus honestat, Dedecorant mores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">arma auro et argento distincta corpus rarae magnitudinis honestabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:44:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 44, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingens corpus erat (Navii), et arma honestabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 5, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20888.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">With inanimate objects</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec domo dominus, sed domino domus honestanda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39:139" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 39, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Pauli currum rex nobilissimus Perses honestavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 10, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput (avis) plumeo apice honestante (with distinguere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 2, 2, § 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">formam pudor honestabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:6" default="NO">3, 6</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exornatio est, qua utimur rei honestandae et locupletandae causa,</quote> <trans><tr>adorn</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 18, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
honestus: <entryFree id="n20889" type="main" key="ho^nestus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏnestus</orth>, <itype>a um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>honos, honor, <cb n="HONE" /> qs. furnished or clothed with honor</etym>, <sense id="n20889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honorable.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20889.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Regarded with honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enjoying respect</hi> or <hi rend="ital">consideration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respectable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noble</hi>, = honoratus: <cit><quote lang="la">qui me honore honestiorem fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 32</bibl></cit>: cum honos sit praemium virtutis judicio studioque civium delatum ad aliquem; <cit><quote lang="la">qui eum sententiis, qui suffragiis adeptus est, is mihi et honestus et honoratus videtur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:81:281" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 81, 281</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis honestam honoratamque imaginem fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:40:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 40, 9</bibl></cit>: magnus atque honestus, Brut. et Cass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 3, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">salvi et honesti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestus homo et nobilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:36:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 36, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum honesto aliquo homine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplae et honestae familiae,</quote> <trans><tr>illustrious and honorable families</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 7, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: homines honestis parentibus ac majoribus nati, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:85" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonis parentibus atque honesto loco natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Tusc. 5:20:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Sabinas honesto ortas loco virgines rapi jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Rep. 2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loco natus honesto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 45, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Polla, Nursiae honesto genere orta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equite Romano in primis honesto et ornato,</quote> <trans><tr>distinguished</tr>, <tr>eminent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 14, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 31, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eques Romanus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 62</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">erant complures honesti adulescentes, senatorum filii et ordinis equestris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:51:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 51, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicani, homines honestissimi atque ornatissimi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo honestissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:53:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 53, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites honestissimi sui generis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginis honestae vaticinatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 9</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quia deus auctor culpae honestior erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam grave, tam firmum, tam honestum municipium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestissimus conventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut honestiore judicio conflictere?</quote> <trans><tr>more honorable</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 13, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies honestissimus nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque erit illa mihi mortis honesta dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 21, 34: <cit><quote lang="la">honesta paupertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:129:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 129, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium honestarum rerum egens,</quote> <trans><tr>not able to live suitably to his rank</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 17</bibl></cit>: honestis manibus omnia laetius proveniunt, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of generals</hi> (cf. shortly before: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsorum tunc manibus imperatorum colebantur agri),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 4, § 19</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20889.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏnestĭōres</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">men of noble birth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui hominem castraverit ... sive is servus sive liber sit, capite punitur: honestiores publicatis bonis in insulam deportantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 23, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 21, 4</bibl> sq.; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. humiliores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 25, 1</bibl></cit> sq.; Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 1, 2, 2; 8, 4, 2.—</sense><sense id="n20889.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏnestum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">honorable conduct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">morality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virtue</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec honesto quicquam honestius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:7:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rigidi servator honesti (Cato),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 389</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n20889.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Bringing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">deserving of honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respectable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">creditable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virtuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">becoming.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20889.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (civium vita) opibus firma, copiis locuples, gloria ampla, virtute honesta sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in convivio moderato atque honesto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequa et honesta postulatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestum ac probabile nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:25:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 25, 71</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut honesta praescriptione rem turpissimam tegerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 32, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causas abeundi quaerat honestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 9, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestam rem actionemve aut non suscipere aut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res, causa (opp. turpis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">honesta res dividitur in rectum et laudabile,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum honestissimorum testimoniis non credere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:49:section=128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 49, § 128</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 6, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines honestissimi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod omnium sit votum parentum, ut honestiores quam sint ipsi, liberos habeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:82" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soror,</quote> <trans><tr>virtuous</tr>, <tr>chaste</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita honestissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:17:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 17, 48</bibl></cit>; so in <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:7:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testimonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae instituta sic distant, ut Cretes et Aetoli latrocinari honestum putent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestum quibusdam rapto vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestius est de amicorum pecunia laborare quam de sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut neque rectum neque honestum sit, nec fieri possit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 21, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestum et rectum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 22, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestum id intellegimus, quod tale est, ut, detracta omni utilitate, sine ullis praemiis fructibusve per se ipsum possit jure laudari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:14:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 14, 45</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:53:159" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 53, 159</bibl>; <cb n="HONO" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:18:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 18, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si maritus uxorem suam in adulterio deprehensam occidit ... non inique aliquid ejus honestissimo calori permittitur, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 4, 10, 1: mores honestos tradere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:239" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 239</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏnestum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">honesty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">integrity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virtue</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">honor, virtus, etc.): quandoquidem honestum aut ipsa virtus est aut res gesta virtute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:Fin. 5:23:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 23, 66</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sive honestum solum bonum est, ut Stoicis placet, sive quod honestum est, id ita summum bonum est, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:Off. 3:3:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 3, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:4:14" default="NO">1, 4, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">formam quidem ipsam et tamquam faciem honesti vides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:ib. 1:5:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis honesti justique disciplina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honesti praesens imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo (honesto) detracto quid poterit beatum intellegi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:15:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 15, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de honesto ac bono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honesta ac turpia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:16:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 16, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 17, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestis similia sunt quaedam non honesta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 16, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eodem pectore nullum est honestorum turpiumque consortium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de honestis, justis, utilibus quaestiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 41</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">honesta mors turpi vita potior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imponit finem sapiens et rebus honestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:444" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 444</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestus rumor alterum est patrimonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0622,001:217" default="NO"><author>Pub. Syr.</author> 217</bibl></cit> Rib.—</sense><sense id="n20889.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of personal appearance, <hi rend="ital">noble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">handsome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beautiful</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ille erat honesta facie et liberali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 24</bibl>; cf.: ita me di ament, honestus est. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat forma praeter ceteras honesta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 1, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 133</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 392</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">asini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:6:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(equi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager honestior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:4:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc ora rigantur honestis Imbribus (i. e. lacrimis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:234" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 234</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏnestum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">beauty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec, si quid honesti est, jactat habetque palam, quaerit, quo turpia celet, = si quid pulchri habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 84</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏ-nestē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n20889.7" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to I.) <hi rend="ital">Honorably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nobly</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">honeste natus,</quote> <trans><tr>of noble birth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 43</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq. and class., </sense><sense id="n20889.8" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to II.) <hi rend="ital">Decently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">becomingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">properly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">creditably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virtuously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque illa matrem satis honeste tuam sequi poterit comes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic volo Te ferre (aquam) honeste, ut ego fero,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde Mundior exiret vix libertinus honeste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut videamur vestiti esse honeste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=31" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 31</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Lucretia) tum quoque jam moriens, ne non procumbat honeste, Respicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:833" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 833</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Caesar) sinum ad ima crura deduxit, quo honestius caderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 82</bibl></cit>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 427, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">valde se honeste gerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestius hic, quam Q. Pompeius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:30:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 30, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae in nostris rebus non satis honeste, in amicorum fiunt honestissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 16, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid recte honesteque dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beate et honeste vivere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honeste vivere (opp. turpiter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere ac dicere (opp. turpiter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:13" default="NO">10, 5, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam jejuna fames, cum possit honestius tremere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:10" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 10</bibl></cit>. iste quidem veteres inter ponetur honeste, <hi rend="ital">fairly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">properly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fastigium nunc honeste vergit in tectum inferioris porticus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
honor: <entryFree id="n20890" type="main" key="ho^nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏnor</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏnos</orth> (the latter form almost exclusively in Cic., who has honor only Phil. 9, 6 <sense id="n20890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>, and Fragm. pro Tull. 21; also in Caes., Liv., Sall., Prop., Verg., Nep., and Curt.; but honor in Sen., Vell., Ov.; and Hor. and Tac. use both forms. Honos was antiquated in Quintilian's day, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 13</bibl>; Neue, Formenl. 1, 168 sq.), ōris (archaic <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> honorus, like venerus, Lex Puteol. ap. <itype>Haubold</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> 7), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>perh. Sanscr. hu-, call</etym>, <hi rend="ital">honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">esteem</hi> in which a person or thing is held. </sense><sense id="n20890.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n20890.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum honos sit praemium virtutis judicio studioque civium delatum ad aliquem, qui eum sententiis, qui suffragiis adeptus est, is mihi et honestus et honoratus videtur. Qui autem occasione aliqua etiam invitis suis civibus nactus est imperium, hunc nomen honoris adeptum, non honorem puto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:81:281" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 81, 281</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">is autem, qui vere appellari potest honos, non invitamentum ad tempus, sed perpetuae virtutis est praemium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:10:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 10, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honos alit artes omnesque incenduntur ad studia gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with gloria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 24, 87</bibl></cit>: si honos is fuit, majorem tibi habere non <pb n="862" /> <cb n="HONO" /> potui, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 20, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto et honor hic illo est amplior, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 2</bibl></cit>, A, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">gratia, dignitate, honore auctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:43:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 43, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplissimis honoribus et praemiis decorari ... honos maximus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:54:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 54, 232</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eum amplissimo regis honore et nomine affeceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem praecipuo honore habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:54:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 54, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suum cuique honorem et gradum reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:47:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 47, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud eum sunt in honore et in pretio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 28, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:61:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 61, 1</bibl>; so with <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in honore magno esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:8:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 8, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summo in honore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:55:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 55, 235</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:19:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 19, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanto in honore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:77:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 77, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 47, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 6, 12</bibl>; but without <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovem autem quanto honore in suo templo fuisse arbitramini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:58:section=129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 58, § 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Druides) magno sunt apud eos honore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 54, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:40:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 40, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 6, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">honorem accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 2</bibl></cit>, A, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">honorem huic generi (i. e. poëtis) non fuisse declarat oratio Catonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honori summo nostro Miloni fuit qui P. Clodii conatus compressit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:17:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 17, 58</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod (i. e. medium ex tribus sedere) apud Numidas honori ducitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rite suum Baccho dicemus honorem,</quote> <trans><tr>honor</tr>, <tr>praise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:393" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 393</bibl></cit>: tanto ille vobis quam mihi pejorem honorem habuit, <hi rend="ital">worse honor</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">greater dishonor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disgrace</hi>, Q. Metell. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:9:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 9, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exsilii honor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>honorable exile</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 21</bibl></cit>.—Personified: <cit><quote lang="la">tute pone te latebis facile, ne inveniat te honos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 37</bibl></cit>.—Of inanim. and abstr. things, <hi rend="ital">honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">esteem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">value</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">physicae quoque non sine causa tributus idem est honos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:22:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 22, 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 26, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornatus ille admirabilis, propter quem ascendit in tantum honorem eloquentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:36:125" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 36, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa renascentur quae jam cecidere, cadentque Quae nunc sunt in honore vocabula, si volet usus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud antiquos piscium nobilissimus habitus acipenser nullo in honore est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 17, 27, § 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:104" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 6, 32, § 104</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vino Pramnio etiam nunc honos durat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:54 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 4, 6, § 54 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n20890.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n20890.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Public honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">official dignity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">office</hi>, <hi rend="ital">post</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preferment</hi> (cf. munus): <cit><quote lang="la">ita quaestor sum factus, ut mihi honorem illum tum non solum datum, sed etiam creditum ac commissum putem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:14:section=35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 14, § 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille honoris gradus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:29:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 29, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites Romanos in tribunicium restituit honorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 77 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extraordinarium honorem appetere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 32, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic ipse honos (sc. dictatura), delatus ad me, testis est innocentiae meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:26:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 26, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curulem adferri sellam eo jussit (Flavius) ac sede honoris sui inimicos spectavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:46:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 46, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honore abiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">deposito honore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paene honore summotus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honor municipalis est administratio rei publicae cum dignitatis gradu, sive cum sumtu, sive sine erogatione contingens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:4:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 4, 14</bibl></cit> pr.: honorem aut magistratum gerere, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 1, 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clari velamen honoris sufficiunt tunicae summis aedilibus albae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:178" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus honoris,</quote> <trans><tr>the term of office</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:150" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honorem militiae largiri,</quote> <trans><tr>military honors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 88</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">populum Romanum hominibus novis industriis libenter honores mandare semperque mandasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:37:section=81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 37, § 81</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (populus) stultus honores Saepe dat indignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ascendisset ad honores, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:68:241" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 68, 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honoribus amplissimis et laboribus maximis perfungi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obrepisti ad honores errore hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catulus maximis honoribus usus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 49:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 49, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratus atque honores capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">largiri opes, honores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 12</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n20890.5" n="2" level="3"> Particular phrases. </sense><sense id="n20890.6" n="a" level="4"> Honoris causa. </sense><sense id="n20890.7" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Out of respect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in order to show honor</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">C. Curio, quem ego hominem honoris potius quam contumeliae causa nominatum volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem honoris causa nomino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toties hunc et virum bonum esse dixisti et honoris causa appellasti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Campanis equitum honoris causa, civitas sine suffragio data,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 14, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:34:8" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 34, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 22, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20890.8" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">For the sake of</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ejus honoris causa, feci thensaurum ut hic reperiret Euclio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:prol. 25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. prol. 25</bibl></cit>: mei honoris causa mittere coquos, <cb n="HONO" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc honoris vostri venio gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestri honoris causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20890.9" n="b" level="4"> Praefari or dicere honorem, to make an excuse in saying any thing that may be distasteful = <hi rend="ital">by your leave</hi> or <hi rend="ital">saving your presence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si dicimus: ille patrem strangulavit, honorem non praefamur. Sin de Aurelia aliquid aut Lollia, honos. praefandus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: haec sunt quae retulisse fas sit, ac pleraque ex his non nisi honore dicto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 24, § 87</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: honos auribus sit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>pardon the expression</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20890.10" n="3" level="3"> Personified, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hŏnor</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hŏnos</orth>, <itype>as a deity whose temple adjoined that of Virtus, and who was worshipped with uncovered head</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:54:section=121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 54, § 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:54:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 54, 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:23:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 23, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 25, 7</bibl> sqq.; Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 21; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr.
