Orell.</author> 543</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n20890.11" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n20890.12" n="A" level="2"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">any thing given as a mark of honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an honorary gift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a reward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acknowledgment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recompense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fee; a sacrifice; funeral rites; a legacy</hi>, etc. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and since the Aug. period): <cit><quote lang="la">Itan tandem hanc majores famam tradiderunt tibi tui, ... honori posterorum tuorum ut vindex fieres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Curio misi, ut medico honos haberetur et tibi daret quod opus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">geminum pugnae proponit honorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 365</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil victor honoris Ex opibus posco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:199" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicite, Pierides, quonam donetur honore Neaera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:1:5" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec Telamon sine honore recessit Hesioneque data potitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arae sacrificiis fument, honore, donis cumulentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:33:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 33, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divūm templis indicit honorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:632" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 632</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:409" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 409</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullos aris adoleret honores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:742" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 742</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meritos aris mactavit honores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honore sepulturae carere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 20, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:55:108" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 55, 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cernit ibi maestos et mortis honore carentes Leucaspim, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:333" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 333</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:3:45" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 3, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mille viri, qui supremum comitentur honorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solutus honos cineri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:357" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 357</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honorem habere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:12:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 12, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem honorem funeri servare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:10:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">communem sepulturae honorem alicui tribuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec enim quaerimus, cui acquiratur, sed cui honos habitus est,</quote> <trans><tr>the honorary legacy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:5:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:11" default="NO">32, 1, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulturae honore spoliatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:7:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:8:1" default="NO">9, 8, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">supremitatis honor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supremus condicionis humanae honos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:3:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20890.13" n="B" level="2"> Objectively, <hi rend="ital">a quality that brings honor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">consideration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an ornament</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beauty</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">silvis Aquilo decussit honorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:404" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 404</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">December silvis honorem decutit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:6" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">populeus cui frondis honor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:296" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 296</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notus in vultus honor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:18" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:788" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 788</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetos oculis afflārat honores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:591" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 591</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:244" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 244</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic tibi copia Manabit ad plenum benigno Ruris honorum opulenta cornu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum ver usquam nullique aestatis honores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:487" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 487</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20890.14" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A magistrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">office-holder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed cum summus honor finito computet anno, sportula quid referat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:117" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 117</bibl></cit>; cf. v. 110.</sense></entryFree>
honorabilis: <entryFree id="n20891" type="main" key="ho^no_ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏnōrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>honoro</etym>, <sense id="n20891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that procures honor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">esteem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honorable</hi> (very rare): haec ipsa sunt honorabilia quae videntur levia atque communia, salutari, appeti, decedi, assurgi, etc., * <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 18, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">personae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honorabilior omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 13, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏnōrābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">honorably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">colebatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sepelire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Macr. 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
honorarium: <entryFree id="n20892" type="main" key="ho^no_ra_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏnōrārĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. honorarius, I. B.</entryFree>
honorarius: <entryFree id="n20893" type="main" key="ho^no_ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏnōrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>honor</etym>, <sense id="n20893.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">done for the sake of conferring honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honorary.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20893.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n20893.2" n="A" level="2"> <pos>Adj.</pos> (class.): cum essem in provincia legatus, quamplures ad praetores et consules vinum honorarium dabant: numquam accepi, ne privatus quidem, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:35:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 35, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumulus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a cenotaph</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 1</bibl></cit>: arbiter, i. e. <hi rend="ital">one chosen out of respect by the parties themselves</hi> (opp. to one chosen by the judge), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:41:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 41, 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:17:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 17, 39</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">arbitria (opp. judicia legitima),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 5, 15</bibl></cit>: opera (opp. severitas <cb n="HONO" /> judicis), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:2:61" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 2, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:3" default="NO">26, 7, 3</bibl>: VACCA, i. e. <hi rend="ital">an honorary offering</hi> (opp. to a sin-offering), Inscr. ap. Marin. Fratr. Arv. 32; 36; <cit><quote lang="la">41: ludi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>given by the magistrates to the people</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 32</bibl></cit>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=102" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 102</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">munus,</quote> <trans><tr>a post of honor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:13:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">codicilli,</quote> <trans><tr>honorary letters-palent</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Theod.</author> 6, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 3, 24, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">docere debitum est, delectare honorarium, permovere necessarium,</quote> <trans><tr>is done out of respect for the audience</tr>, <tr>voluntarily</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curatores honorarii, qui a praetore constituuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 12, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. § 3.—</sense><sense id="n20893.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏnōrārĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. donum), <hi rend="ital">a present made on being admitted to a post of honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a douceur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fee</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honorary</hi> (post-class.): decurionatus, Traj. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carae cognationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:6:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in honorariis advocatorum ita versari judex debet, ut pro modo litis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:13:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:8 al" default="NO">26, 7, 8 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n20893.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in jurid. Lat., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the prœtorian law</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">law of custom</hi> (opp. to laws strictly defined by statutes): <cit><quote lang="la">(jus) honorarium dicitur, quod ab honore praetoris venerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2:section=10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2, § 10</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">actio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:28" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 30, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obligatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:1:5" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 20, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">successor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:4:13" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 46, 4, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
honorate: <entryFree id="n20894" type="main" key="ho^no_ra_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏnōrātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. honoro, <sense id="n20894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
honoratio: <entryFree id="n20895" type="main" key="ho^no_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏnōrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>honoro</etym>, <sense id="n20895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mark of respect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honor</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 221</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 7</bibl>; Paul. ex Fest. s. v. gradivus, p. 97 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
honoratus: <entryFree id="n20896" type="main" key="ho^no_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏnōrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from honoro.</entryFree>
honoriades: <entryFree id="n20897" type="main" key="Ho^no_ri^a^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hŏnōrĭădes</orth>, ae; <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ĭānus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um; <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ĭas</orth>, <itype>adis</itype>, v. Honorius.</entryFree>
honorifice: <entryFree id="n20898" type="main" key="ho^no_ri^fi^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏnōrĭfĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. honorificus <sense id="n20898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
honorificentia: <entryFree id="n20899" type="main" key="ho^no_ri^fi^centi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏnōrĭfĭcentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>honorificus</etym>, <sense id="n20899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a doing of honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honor</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">imperialis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 6:36" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 6, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 25, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> de Abr. 2, 10, 69</bibl>; id. de Jacob, 2, 2, 7.</sense></entryFree>
honorifico: <entryFree id="n20900" type="main" key="ho^no_ri^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏnōrĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20900.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to do honor to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to honor</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">regem magnum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ira D. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Salvatorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 119" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 119</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
honorificus: <entryFree id="n20901" type="main" key="ho^no_ri^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏnōrĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>honor + facio</etym>, <sense id="n20901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that does honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honorable</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">numquam ab eo mentio de me nisi honorifica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:15:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 15, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tu a me rebus amplissimis atque honorificentissimis ornatus esses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem meam in te honorificam fuisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">3: honorificentissima verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 11, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seria partitur (Domitius Marsus) in tria genera, honorificum, contumeliosum, medium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:108" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 108</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § <cit><quote lang="la">6: si quid honorificum pagina blanda sonat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:45:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 45, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">P. Clodius in senatu sub honorificentissimo ministerii titulo M. Catonem a re publica relegavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:45:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 45, 4</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">honorificentius est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏnōrĭfĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">honorably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with honor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">respect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honorably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid de aliquo honorifice praedicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 13, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respondere alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consurgitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:62:section=138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 62, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promittere (with large),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 11:44" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 11, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iratus, quod ... nihil in se honorifice neque publice neque privatum factum esset,</quote> <trans><tr>that no honors had been shown him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nemini sit triumphus honorificentius quam mihi salus restitutioque perscripta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:15:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 15, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec liberalius nec honorificentius se potuisse tractari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 27, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem honorificentissime appellare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae tuae cum amantissime tum honorificentissime scriptae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 13</bibl></cit>, B, 2.</sense></entryFree>
honoriger: <entryFree id="n20902" type="main" key="ho^no_ri^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏnōrĭger</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>honorgero</etym>, <sense id="n20902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that brings honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honorable</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">nota virginitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Verg. Vell. 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
honorinus: <entryFree id="n20903" type="main" key="Ho^no_ri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hŏnōrīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, i. q. Honor, <sense id="n20903.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the god of honor</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 21 dub. (al. Honor).</sense></entryFree>
honoripeta: <entryFree id="n20904" type="hapax" key="ho^no_ri^pe^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏnōrĭpĕta</orth>, ae. <gen>m.</gen> <etym>honor-peto</etym>, <sense id="n20904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">striving for honors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ambitious</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
honorius: <entryFree id="n20905" type="main" key="Ho^no_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hŏnōrĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20905.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of the emperor Theodosius I.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and brother of Arcadius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the first emperor of the western Roman empire</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Nupt. Hon. 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 48" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 48 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n20905.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n20905.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hŏnōrĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the emperor Honorius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Honorian</hi>: thermae, Cod. Theod. <pb n="863" /> <cb n="HORA" /> 15, 1, 50.—</sense><sense id="n20905.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hŏnōrĭădes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a male descendant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of the emperor Honorius</hi>, Claud. Nupt. Hon. et Mar. 341.—</sense><sense id="n20905.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hŏnōrĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a female descendant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of the emperor Honorius</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Seren. 130</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
honoro: <entryFree id="n20906" type="main" key="ho^no_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏnōro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (<sense id="n20906.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">depon.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dionysius Platonem in litore occurrens honoratus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1, § 123</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, § 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1206,001:2:5" default="NO"><author>Ampel.</author> 2, 5</bibl>) [honor], <hi rend="ital">to clothe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adorn with honor; to honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respect; to adorn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ornament</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embellish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decorate</hi> (class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">honeste): mortem ejus (Ser. Sulpicii) non monumento sed luctu publico esse honorandam putarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornandi honorandique potestas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 17, 45</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">honorandus sum, quia tyrannum occidi (opp. puniendus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:74" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 74</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 4, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Amphiaraüm sic honoravit fama Graeciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:40:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 40, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquos sellis curulibus, toga praetexta, corona triumphali laureaque honorare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: populum congiariis, <hi rend="ital">to honor</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">present</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:129:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 129, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">cf: nisi in arena passi sunt se honorari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:10:15" default="NO">48, 10, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">honoratus equestri statua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:61:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 61, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollo lyram modo nato flore honorabat,</quote> <trans><tr>adorned</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lato clavo vel equo publico similive honore honorari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏnō-rātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">honored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respected; honorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respectable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20906.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen. [class.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui honorem sententiis, qui suffragiis adeptus est, is mihi et honestus et honoratus videtur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:81:281" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 81, 281</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis honestam honoratamque imaginem fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:40:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 40, 9</bibl></cit>: beati, qui honorati sunt, videntur; <cit><quote lang="la">miseri autem, qui sunt inglorii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:11:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 11, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clari et honorati viri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo et princeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39:138" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 39, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honoratus et nobilis Thucydides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:9:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 9, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Achilles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefectura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amici,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>courtiers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:54:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 54, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rus,</quote> <trans><tr>granted as a mark of honor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:617" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 617</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">sedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 63</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dionysius apud me honoratior fuit, quam apud Scipionem Panaetius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes honoratioris militiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:23:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 23, 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus pollens atque honoratissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honoratissimo loco lectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:76:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 76, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honoratissimae imaginis vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:58:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 58, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus assensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20906.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">honored by a public office</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filling a post of honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respectable</hi> (perh. not anteAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">praetor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:52" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul honoratus vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:5:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honoratior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:54" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 54 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familia honorata magis quam nobilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 7, 18</bibl></cit>: si quis forte honoratorum, decurionum, possessorum, etc., Cod. Th. 9, 27, 6; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3540</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3971 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">HONORATVS AD CVRAM KALENDARII,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 444, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honoratae comae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of a high magistrate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:92" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 2, 92</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20906.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conferring honor</hi>, = honorificus (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">senatus quam poterat honoratissimo decreto adlocutus eos mandat consulibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 10, 6</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏnōrātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honorably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam illum et honorate nec secure continet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:129:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 129, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod filium honorate custodierant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 63</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum contumeliosius expulerint, an revocaverint honoratius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:4:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 4, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:1:11" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 1, 11</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem honoratissime excipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:10:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 10, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
honorus: <entryFree id="n20907" type="main" key="ho^no_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏnōrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>honor, analog. with decorus from decor</etym> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose). * <sense id="n20907.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Worthy of honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honorable</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:40" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 40</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20907.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That confers honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honorable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <trans><tr>glorifying</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:342" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 342</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:629" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 629</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae in Drusum patrem Germanici honora et magnifica Augustus fecisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honora de Germanico disserebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 68</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
honos: <entryFree id="n20908" type="main" key="ho^nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏnos</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. honor.</entryFree>
honus: <entryFree id="n20909" type="gloss" key="ho^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏnus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏnustus</orth>, v. onus <sense id="n20909.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
hoplites: <entryFree id="n20910" type="greek" key="hopli_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hoplītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o(pli/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n20910.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a heavyarmed man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 71</bibl>, v. Sillig. ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
hoplomachus: <entryFree id="n20911" type="main" key="hoplo^ma^chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hoplŏmăchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o(ploma/xos</foreign>, <sense id="n20911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a heavy-armed combatant</hi>, a sort of gladiator, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:74:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 74, 1</bibl>; Firm. Math. 8, 21; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2566</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hora: <entryFree id="n20912" type="main" key="ho_ra1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hōra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (archaic <sense id="n20912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> horāï, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1016" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1016</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi> HORABVS, <cb n="HORA" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4601</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindred with <foreign lang="greek">w(/ra</foreign>; Zend yare, year; ayara, day; orig. for <foreign lang="greek">vo</foreign>sara, from <foreign lang="greek">ve/ar</foreign>, ver</etym>, (lit., a definite space of time, fixed by natural laws; hence, as in Greek). </sense><sense id="n20912.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An hour.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20912.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (among the Romans, of varying length, according to the time of year, from sunrise to sunset being reckoned as twelve hours; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas, aevum, tempus, dies): aestiva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:1:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">viginti milia passuum horis quinque duntaxat aestivis conficienda sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horam amplius jam in demoliendo signo moliebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">īdem eadem possunt horam durare probantes?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ternas epistolas in hora dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hora saepe ducentos versus dictabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horas tres dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum dormiit ad horas tres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quatuor horarum spatio antecedens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 79 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quatuor aut plures aulaea premuntur in horas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non amplius quam septem horas dormiebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:78" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec (cogitatio) paucis admodum horis magnas etiam causas complectitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:6:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucissimarum horarum consulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 53, 54, § 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hora quota est?</quote> <trans><tr>what o'clock is it?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntiare horas,</quote> <trans><tr>to tell the time of day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:216" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 216</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum a puero quaesisset horas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 53, 54, § 182</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si te grata quies et primam somnus in horam Delectat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hora secunda postridie,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quartā vix demum exponimur horā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ad te quinta fere hora venissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea res acta est, cum hora sexta vix Pompeius perorasset, usque ad horam octavam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hora fere nona,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hora diei decima fere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:31:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 31, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hora fere undecima aut non multo secus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 10, 29</bibl></cit>: prima salutantes atque altera continet hora; <cit><quote lang="la">Exercet raucos tertia causidicos: In quintam varios extendit Roma labores: Sexta quies lassis, septima finis erit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post horam primam noctis. ... decem horis nocturnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima noctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus nocturnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quidem in horam diei quintam vel octavam spectare maluerint, i. e.,</quote> <trans><tr>towards that part of the heavens where the sun is at the fifth or eighth hour</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 11, 16, § 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:202" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 32, 37, § 202</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic tu fortasse eris diligens, ne quam ego horam de meis legitimis horis remittam,</quote> <trans><tr>of the hours allowed to an orator</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:9:section=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 9, § 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hora partūs,</quote> <trans><tr>the hour of one's birth</tr>, <tr>natal hour</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hora natalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:17:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 17, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 21</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad horam venire,</quote> <trans><tr>at the hour</tr>, <tr>punctually</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clavum mutare in horas,</quote> <trans><tr>every hour</tr>, <tr>hourly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 13, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 17, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20912.3" n="2" level="3"> Prov. </sense><sense id="n20912.4" n="a" level="4"> In horam vivere, <hi rend="ital">to care only for the passing hour</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to live from hand to mouth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 9, 25</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n20912.5" n="b" level="4"> Omnium horarum homo (amicus, etc.), <hi rend="ital">ready</hi>, <hi rend="ital">active</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well disposed at all times</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:110" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 110</bibl> Spald.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 42</bibl> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Publicium solitum dicere, P. Mummium cuivis tempori hominem esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:67:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 67, 271</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n20912.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hōrae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a horologe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clock</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum machinatione quadam moveri aliquid videmus, ut sphaeram, ut horas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:38:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 38, 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 71</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">videt oscitantem judicem, mittentem ad horas,</quote> <trans><tr>to look at the clock</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:54:200" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 54, 200</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n20912.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">time of year</hi>, <hi rend="ital">season</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu quamcumque deus tibi fortunaverit horam, Grata sume manu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et mihi forsan, tibi quod negarit, Porriget hora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 16, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neu fluitem dubiae spe pendulus horae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui recte vivendi prorogat horam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremo veniet mollior hora die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:28" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 28</bibl></cit> (3, 24), 16: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam te crastina fallet Hora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:426" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 426</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub verni temporis horam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 302</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of spring: genitalis anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 54, § 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagrantis atrox hora Caniculae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 13, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(hae latebrae) Incolumem tibi me praestant Septembribus horis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor ipsa omnibus horis pomifera est,</quote> <trans><tr>at all seasons</tr>, <tr>all the year round</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 3, 7, § 15</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n20912.8" n="III" level="1"> Personified: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hōrae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*(/wrai</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the Hours</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daughters of Jupiter and Themis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">goddesses that presided over</hi> <cb n="HORD" /> <hi rend="ital">the changes of the seasons and kept watch at the gates of heaven</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:92" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:410" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 410</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:125" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 125</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 217</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 183" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 183</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n20913" type="main" key="Ho_^ra2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hō^ra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. an old form for hĕra, lady</etym>, <sense id="n20913.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wife of Quirinus</hi> (<hi rend="ital">Romulus</hi>), <hi rend="ital">who was worshipped as a goddess</hi> (called, before her death, Hersilia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:830" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 830</bibl>): Quirine pater, veneror, Horamque Quirini, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 120, 2</bibl> (Ann. v. 121 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">Hora Quirini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:22:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 22, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pariter cum corpore nomen Mutat Horamque vocat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:851" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 851</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
horaeus: <entryFree id="n20914" type="greek" key="ho_raeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hōraeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">w(rai=os</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">ta/rixos</foreign>), <sense id="n20914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">salted in season</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scomber,</quote> <trans><tr>pickled mackerel</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 71</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
horalis: <entryFree id="n20915" type="main" key="ho_ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hōrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hora</etym>, <sense id="n20915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to an hour</hi> (late Lat.): spatium, i. e., <hi rend="ital">of an hour</hi>, Venant. Vit. S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:364" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 364</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
horarium: <entryFree id="n20916" type="main" key="ho_ra_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hōrārĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clock</hi> (late Lat.), Censorin. de Die Nat. 23 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
horatius: <entryFree id="n20917" type="main" key="Ho^ra_ti^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hŏrātĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n20917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n20917.1" n="a" level="4"> Horatii, <hi rend="ital">the three brothers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the time of Tullus Hostilius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who fought against the Alban</hi> Curiatii, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:24 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 24 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n20917.2" n="b" level="4"> Horatius Cocles, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the war with Porsenna</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defended a bridge single-handed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20917.3" n="c" level="4"> Q. Horatius Flaccus, <hi rend="ital">the famous Augustan poet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:62" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 62</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hŏ-rātĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the sister of the</hi> Horatii, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n20917.4" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n20917.5" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hŏrātĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Horatius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Horatian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 359</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:7:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 7, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20917.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hŏrātĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the poet Horace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Horatian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille Atabulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:22:25" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 22, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n20918" type="main" key="Ho^ra_ti^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hŏrātĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. 1. Horatius, II. A.</entryFree>
horconia: <entryFree id="n20919" type="main" key="horconia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">horconia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n20919.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of wine in Campania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
horctum: <entryFree id="n20920" type="gloss" key="horctum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">horctum</orth> et <orth extent="full" lang="la">forctum</orth> <itype>pro bono dicebant</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=102" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 102</bibl> Müll.: cf. fortis <sense id="n20920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
horda: <entryFree id="n20921" type="gloss" key="horda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">horda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, archaic i. q. forda, <sense id="n20921.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cow that is with calf</hi>: quae sterilis est vacca, taura appellata; <cit><quote lang="la">quae praegnans, horda: ab eo in fastis dies hordicalia nominantur, quod tunc hordae boves immolantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; v. fordus.</sense></entryFree>
hordeaceus: <entryFree id="n20922" type="main" key="horde^a_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hordĕācĕus</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ord-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hordeum</etym>, <sense id="n20922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to barley</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barley-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">farina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 13, 51, § 135</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 11, 26, § 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">farrago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:99" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">messis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 29, 71, § 295</bibl></cit>: pira, <hi rend="ital">barley-pears</hi>, i. e., <hi rend="ital">ripe at the barleyharvest</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hordearius: <entryFree id="n20923" type="main" key="horde^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hordĕārĭus</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">ordearius</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">hordĭarius</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relat. ing to barley</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barley-</hi>: pira, <hi rend="ital">barley-pears</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">pears that are ripe at barley-harvest</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 15, 16, § 55</bibl> (also called hordeacea pira, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 18</bibl>); so, <cit><quote lang="la">pruna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 13, 12, § 41</bibl></cit>: hordiarium aes, quod pro hordeo equiti Romano dabatur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=102" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 102</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:43:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 43, 9</bibl> (Weissenb. ad loc.): <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:27" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquissimum in cibis hordeum, sicut Atheniensium ritu apparet et gladiatorum cognomine, qui hordearii vocabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 14, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia ex qua hordeum equis erat comparandum ... dicebatur aes hordiarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:27" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 27</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n20923.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Like barley</hi>, i. e. inflated: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc eundem M. Coelius hordearium rhetorem appellat, deridens ut inflatum ac levem et sordidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hordeius: <entryFree id="n20924" type="hapax" key="horde_i^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hordēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20924.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to barley</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barley-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lolligiunculae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Casin. 2, 8, 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hordeolus: <entryFree id="n20925" type="main" key="hordeo^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hordeŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sty in the eye</hi>, Marc. Empir. 8; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 4, 8, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hordeum: <entryFree id="n20926" type="main" key="horde^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hordĕum</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">ordeum</orth>, and arch. <orth extent="full" lang="la">fordeum</orth> acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 14</bibl>), i. <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. root ghars-, to rub, grind; O. H. Germ. Gers-ta</etym>, <sense id="n20926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">barley</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 10, § 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 35, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:3 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 3 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 13, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frugibus legatis hordeum continetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6, 78</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 317</bibl>; on account of this plur. he was abused by the poet Bavius; v. Bavius; cf. also: hordea et mulsa non alio vitiosa sunt, quam quod singularia pluraliter efferuntur. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 16</bibl>; <number>plur.</number> also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 10, § 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hordiarius: <entryFree id="n20927" type="main" key="hordi^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hordĭārĭus</orth>, v. hordearius.</entryFree>
hordicalia: <entryFree id="n20928" type="gloss" key="hordica_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hordicālĭa</orth>, v. horda and fordus. <pb n="864" /> <cb n="HORR" /></entryFree>
hordicidia: <entryFree id="n20929" type="gloss" key="hordicidia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hordicidia</orth>, v. ‡ fordicidia.</entryFree>
hordus: <entryFree id="n20930" type="main" key="hordus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hordus</orth>, v. fordus.</entryFree>
horesti: <entryFree id="n20931" type="main" key="Horesti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Horesti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tribe in North Britain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the modern Stirling</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">the north part of Lanark</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 38</bibl> (al. Boresti).</sense></entryFree>
horia: <entryFree id="n20932" type="main" key="ho^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏrĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">oria</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n20932.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small vessel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fishing-smack</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">celox, catascopium, prosumia, lembus, etc.): horia navicula piscatoria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 533, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:25:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 25, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
horiola: <entryFree id="n20933" type="main" key="ho^ri^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏrĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>horia</etym>, <sense id="n20933.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a skiff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fishing-boat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:25:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 25, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
horior: <entryFree id="n20934" type="main" key="ho^ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏrĭor</orth>, <itype>hori</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏrĭtor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>prim. forms of hortor, from the root <foreign lang="greek">*o*r*w</foreign>, whence <foreign lang="greek">o)/rnumi, o(rmh/, o(rma/w</foreign>, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n20934.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to urge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encourage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortatur quod vulgo dicimus, veteres nonnulli horitur dixerunt, ut Ennius libro XVI. (29): prandere jubet horiturque. Idem in X. (28): horitatur induperator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 378</bibl></cit> P. (Ann. v. 409 and 350 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
horistice: <entryFree id="n20935" type="greek" key="ho^risti^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏristĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o(ristikh/</foreign>, <sense id="n20935.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the defining</hi> or <hi rend="ital">theoretical part of grammar</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 421</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
horitor: <entryFree id="n20936" type="hapax" key="ho^ri^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏrĭtor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, v. horior <sense id="n20936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
horizon: <entryFree id="n20937" type="greek" key="ho^ri_zon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏrīzon</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o(ri/zwn</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">ku/klos</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">a)h/r</foreign>). <sense id="n20937.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The horizon</hi> (pure Lat. finiens and finitor), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 7, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 1:4" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 1, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20937.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A line drawn through the centre of a sundial</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hormenos: <entryFree id="n20938" type="greek" key="horme^nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hormĕnos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o(/rmenos</foreign>, the Greek name of <sense id="n20938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wild asparagus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 42, § 151</bibl> (as Greek, Jan.).</sense></entryFree>
horminum: <entryFree id="n20939" type="greek" key="hormi_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hormīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o(/rminon</foreign>, <sense id="n20939.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the herb clary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of sage</hi>, Salvia horminum, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 76, § 159</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:96" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 10, 22, § 96</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hormiscion: <entryFree id="n20940" type="greek" key="hormisci^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hormiscĭon</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o(rmi/skos</foreign>, <sense id="n20940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 60, § 168</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
horno: <entryFree id="n20941" type="main" key="horno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">horno</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. hornus <sense id="n20941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
hornotinus: <entryFree id="n20942" type="main" key="horno_ti^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hornōtĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hornus</etym>, <sense id="n20942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of this year</hi>, <hi rend="ital">this year's</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:18:section=45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 18, § 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
hornus: <entryFree id="n20943" type="main" key="hornus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hornus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contr. for hōrinus = <foreign lang="greek">w(/rinos</foreign> from <foreign lang="greek">w(/ra</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n20943.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of this year</hi>, <hi rend="ital">this year's</hi> (not in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">but cf. hornotinus): agni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit>, (5), 3, 61: <cit><quote lang="la">fruge,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 6, 88</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">horno</orth>, <hi rend="ital">this year</hi>: utrum anno an horno te abstuleris a viro? Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 121, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">horno messis magna fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 121, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
horologiaris: <entryFree id="n20944" type="gloss" key="ho_ro^lo^gi^a_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hōrŏlŏgĭāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>horologium</etym>, <sense id="n20944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a horologe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clock</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">TEMPLVM,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>provided with a clock</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1276</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">abbrev., HOROLOGIAR. TEMPLVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 925</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
horologicus: <entryFree id="n20945" type="greek" key="ho_ro^lo^gi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hōrŏlŏgĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">w(rologiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a clock</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, 194</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
horologium: <entryFree id="n20946" type="main" key="ho_ro^lo^gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hōrŏlŏgĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">w(rolo/gion</foreign>, <sense id="n20946.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a clock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">horologe</hi>, either a <hi rend="ital">sundial</hi> or a <hi rend="ital">waterclock</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 76, 78, § 187</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:213" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 60, 60, § 213</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:8 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 8 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2032</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3298</bibl> sq.</sense></entryFree>
horoscopicus: <entryFree id="n20947" type="main" key="ho_rosco^pi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hōroscŏpĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>horoscopus</etym>, <sense id="n20947.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indicating the hour</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 72, 74, § 182</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20947.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Relating to nativities</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1, 12 al.</bibl></cit>—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hōroscŏ-pĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the casting of nativities</hi>, Mythogr. Lat. 3, 13.</sense></entryFree>
horoscopium: <entryFree id="n20948" type="greek" key="ho_rosco^pi_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hōroscŏpīum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-pĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">w(roskopei=on</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">-sko/pion</foreign>, <sense id="n20948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an instrument used in the casting of nativities</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
horoscopo: <entryFree id="n20949" type="greek" key="ho_rosco^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hōroscŏpo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">w(roskope/w</foreign>, <sense id="n20949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take the time of one's nativity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to draw a horoscope</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 3, 296</bibl>; Firm. Math. 5, 1.</sense></entryFree>
horoscopus: <entryFree id="n20950" type="greek" key="ho_rosco^pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hōroscŏpus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">w(rosko/pos</foreign>, <sense id="n20950.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that shows the hour.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20950.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 72, 74, § 182</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 595</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n20950.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">horoscopus</orth>, i. <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a nativity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">horoscope</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:18" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 3, 190</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">200</bibl> sq.; Aug. Civ. Dei, 5, 2 sq.</sense></entryFree>
horrearius: <entryFree id="n20951" type="main" key="horre^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">horrĕārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>horreum</etym>, <sense id="n20951.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the superintendent of a storehouse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">magazine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:60:section=9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 60, § 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:3:5:section=3" default="NO">9, 3, 5, § 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:4:5" default="NO">10, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3214 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
horreaticus: <entryFree id="n20952" type="main" key="horre^a_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">horrĕātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20952.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a storehouse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">species,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the corn stored up in a magazine</tr></trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Theod.</author> 11, 14, 3</bibl></cit>. <cb n="HORR" /></sense></entryFree>
horrende: <entryFree id="n20953" type="main" key="horrende_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">horrendē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. horreo, <sense id="n20953.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
horrentia: <entryFree id="n20954" type="main" key="horrenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">horrentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>horreo</etym>, <sense id="n20954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shuddering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">horror</hi> (post-class. for horror), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
horreo: <entryFree id="n20955" type="main" key="horre^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">horrĕo</orth>, <itype>ui, ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n20955.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [for horseo, kindred to Sanscr. hrish, to stand erect, to bristle], <hi rend="ital">to stand on end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stand erect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bristle.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20955.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (for the most part only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Ciceron. prose): in corpore pili, ut arista in spica hordei, horrent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=49" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 49</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et setae densis similes hastilibus horrent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe horrere sacros doluit Latona capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:23" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrentibus per totum corpus villis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 40, 61, § 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrentes barbae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrentibus scopulis gradum inferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:81:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 81, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrentes rubi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 315</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrentibus hastis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrebant densis aspera crura pilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:348" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 348</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rigidis setis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:846" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 846</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horret capillis ut marinus asperis Echinus aut currens aper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:27" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervigil ecce draco squamis crepitantibus horrens Sibilat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 101</bibl></cit>: densantur campis horrentia tela virorum, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 866</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 288 Vahl.); cf.: hastis longis campus splendet et horret, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 4</bibl> (Sat. v. 15 Vahl.); imitated <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:602" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 602</bibl> Serv.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:41:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 41, 6</bibl>: mare cum horret fluctibus, <hi rend="ital">is ruffled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 422, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duris cautibus horrens Caucasus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:366" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 366</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvis horrentia saxa fragosis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:778" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 778</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n20955.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n20955.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To move in an unsteady</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shaking manner.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20955.4" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to shake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tremble</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">corpus ut impulsae segetes Aquilonibus horret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 139</bibl></cit>; cf. horresco.—</sense><sense id="n20955.5" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n20955.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To shake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shiver</hi> with cold, rigere (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">saepe etiam dominae, quamvis horrebis et ipse, Algentis manus est calfacienda sinu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A.
