A. 2, 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrenti tunicam non reddere servo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:93" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sola pruinosis horret facundia pannis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20955.7" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To tremble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shudder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quake</hi> with fright; more freq. as a <hi rend="ital">verb. act.</hi>, with an object, <hi rend="ital">to shudder</hi> or <hi rend="ital">be frightened at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tremble at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be afraid of</hi> (the class. signif. of the word, equally freq. in prose and poetry; cf.: exsecror, abominor, aversor, abhorreo, odi, exhorresco). </sense><sense id="n20955.8" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">totus, Parmeno, Tremo horreoque, postquam aspexi hanc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Extimuit tum illa? <hi rend="ital">Me.</hi> Horret corpus, cor salit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arrectis auribus horrent Quadrupedes monstrique metu turbantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:516" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 516</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scilicet horreres majoraque monstra putares, si mulier vitulum ederet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:122" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 122</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20955.9" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qui imbecillius horrent dolorem et reformidant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:30:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 30, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum (conscientiam) horrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium et crimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:29:section=74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 29, § 74</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ingrati animi crimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 2</bibl></cit>, A, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsam victoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: Ariovisti crudelitatem, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 32, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen ipsum accusatoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:7:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fragilitatis humanae vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:27:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauperiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">onus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iratum mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutum divitis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strictas secures trepida cervice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:695" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 695</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">te Negligit aut horret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 64</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quem dives amicus odit et horret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrent admotas vulnera cruda manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:3:16" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem ac tela horrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:53:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 53, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:8:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:2:33" default="NO">9, 2, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illam, quam laudibus effert, horrere,</quote> <trans><tr>to loathe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:183" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 183</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n20955.10" n="(g)" level="5"> With an <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relat.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego vestris armis armatus non horrui in hunc locum progredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:37:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 37, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horreo dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:40:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 40, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horret animus referre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 37, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 29, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 15, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 17, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominatio tanto in odio est omnibus, ut quorsus eruptura sit, horreamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 21, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 27, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quemadmodum accepturi sitis, horreo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20955.11" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo plus horreo, ne illae magis res nos ceperint, quam nos illas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20955.12" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To shudder with amazement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be astonished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amazed</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quae mehercule ego, Crasse, cum tractantur in causis, horrere soleo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:45:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 45, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo horrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:55:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 55, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:6:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 6, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. horrendus, 2.—</sense><sense id="n20955.13" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be of a rough</hi> or <hi rend="ital">frightful appearance; to look rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">look frightful; to be terrible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dreadful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">horrid</hi> (rare; mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">possetne uno tempore florere, deinde vicissim horrere terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:7:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: quaedam loca frigoribus hiemis<cb n="HORR" />  intolerabiliter horrent, Col. 1, 4, 9; <bibl default="NO"><author>German.</author> Progn. 2, 158</bibl>; cf.: nec fera tempestas toto tamen horret in anno. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:495" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 495</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:1" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20955.14" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrebant saevis omnia verba minis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 664</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n20955.15" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">horrens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to I.), <hi rend="ital">bristly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shaggy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">horrens Arcadius sus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrentique atrum nemus imminet umbra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrentes Marte Latinos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrensque feris altaribus Esus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 445</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20955.16" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">hor-rendus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n20955.17" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to II. A. 2. b.) <hi rend="ital">Dreadful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fearful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrific</hi>, <hi rend="ital">horrible</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">horrendum et dictu video mirabile monstrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">truces horrendaeque imagines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:52:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 52, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva invia atque horrenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 36, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Roma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rabies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:323" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 323</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diluvies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 14, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas (with foeda),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:100:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 100, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:140" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:210" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 210</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lex erat horrendi carminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis Parthis horrendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallor utrasque Fecerat horrendas aspectu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res horrenda relatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 298</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrendum dictu!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 454</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr. adv.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">belua Lernae Horrendum stridens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 288</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma Horrendum sonuere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 732</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 700: intonet horrendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:485" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 485</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrenda circumsonantibus Alemannis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 10, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20955.18" n="2" level="3"> In a good sense, <hi rend="ital">wonderful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">awful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venerable</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">horrenda virgo (Camilla),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:507" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 507</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrendae procul secreta Sibyllae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tectum augustum, ingens ... Horrendum silvis et religione parentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 172</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">horrendē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">dreadfully</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
horreolum: <entryFree id="n20956" type="hapax" key="horre^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">horrĕŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>horreum</etym>, <sense id="n20956.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small barn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">granary</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
horresco: <entryFree id="n20957" type="main" key="horresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">horresco</orth>, <itype>horrŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n20957.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [horreo], <hi rend="ital">to rise on end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stand erect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bristle up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grow rough.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20957.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">horreo): rettulit ille gradus horrueruntque comae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:502" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 502</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum segetes altae campique natantes Lenibus horrescunt flabris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia coeperunt nigris horrescere villis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:478" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 478</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">setis horrescere coepi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:279" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 279</bibl></cit>: horrescit telis exercitus asper utrimque, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 385 Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">arma rigent, horrescunt tela,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> (Trag. v. 177 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">mollis horrescit coma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 711" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 711</bibl></cit>: horrescit mare, <hi rend="ital">becomes ruffled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 423, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ille qui navigat, cum subito mare coepit horrescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,062:ib. 4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fragm. ib. 4</bibl></cit> (Rep. 1, 40 Mos.).—</sense><sense id="n20957.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n20957.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To fall a shaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trembling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(puella) Horruit, ut steriles, agitat quas ventus, aristae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:553" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 553</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20957.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to begin to shake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shudder</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">tremble</hi> for fear, <hi rend="ital">to become frightened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrified</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n20957.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">horresco misera, mentio quoties fit partionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 93</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 4, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 4, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin etiam ferae, sibi injecto terrore mortis, horrescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horresco referens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrescit visu subito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 710</bibl></cit>; 12, 453. —</sense><sense id="n20957.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum procellas Cautus horrescis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morsus futuros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:394" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 394</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullos visus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:453" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 453</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:70" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20957.7" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrescit animus omnia recensere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20957.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To grow fearful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dreadful</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">in terra quoque ut horrescant (fulmina),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subitis horrescit turbida nimbis Tempestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:134" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 134</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
horreum: <entryFree id="n20958" type="main" key="horre^um1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">horrĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cf.: farreum, farina</etym>, <sense id="n20958.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a storehouse;</hi> esp. for preserving grain, <hi rend="ital">a barn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">granary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magazine</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">sirus, granarium, cumera): illi Capuam cellam atque horreum Campani agri esse voluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:33:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 33, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si proprio condidit horreo, Quicquid de Libycis verritur areis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:8:section=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 8, § 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:42:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 42, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illius immensae ruperunt horrea messes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 49</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:84" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si, quicquid arat impiger Appulus, Occultare meis dicerer horreis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 27</bibl></cit>.—For other things: <cit><quote lang="la">parcis deripere horreo amphoram?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 28, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:76" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 1, 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum, quod in domo, vel intra horreum usibus ejus fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:33" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 34, 2, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:4:5" default="NO">10, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:52:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 52, 3</bibl>.—In fig.: nunc argumentum vobis demensum dabo, non modio neque tri modio, verum ipso horreo, Plaut. Men. prol. <pb n="865" /> <cb n="HORR" /> 15.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of a <hi rend="ital">beehive</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 250</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">ant-burrows</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:6:39" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 6, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n20959" type="main" key="Horre^um2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Horrĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n20959.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Molossis in Epirus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of uncertain site</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:26:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 26, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
horribilis: <entryFree id="n20960" type="main" key="horri^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">horrĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>horreo</etym>, <sense id="n20960.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">terrible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fearful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dreadful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">horrible</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n20960.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod hanc tam tetram, tam horribilem tamque infestam rei publicae pestem toties jam effugimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homini accidere nihil posse, quod sit horribile aut pertimescendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: species, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 36, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectaculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 101:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 101, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 99:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 99, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di magni, horribilem et sacrum libellum!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 14, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formidines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:19:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 19, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horribiles miserosque casus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mars (stella) rutilus horribilisque terris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud vero fuit horribile, quod vereor, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:61:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 61, 258</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horribile est causam capitis dicere, horribilius priore loco dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 31, 95</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20960.2" n="II" level="1"> In colloquial lang., sometimes in a good sense, <hi rend="ital">astonishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amazing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tremendous</hi>: sed hoc <foreign lang="greek">te/ras</foreign> (i. e. Cæsar) horribili vigilantia, celeritate, diligentia est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uterque juravit, inter nos periturum esse tam horribile secretum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 21, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">horrĭbĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">amazingly;</hi> in a good sense: horribiliter scripsisti hanc orationem, M. Aurel. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. 2:6" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. 2, 6</bibl> Mai.; August. Civ. Dei, 1, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
horricomis: <entryFree id="n20961" type="main" key="horri^co^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">horrĭcŏmis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>horreo-coma</etym>, <sense id="n20961.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with hair on end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bristly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shaggy</hi> (Appuleian): <cit><quote lang="la">canes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hircus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl></cit>, p. 192.</sense></entryFree>
horride: <entryFree id="n20962" type="main" key="horri^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">horrĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. horridus <sense id="n20962.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
horridulus: <entryFree id="n20963" type="main" key="horri^du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">horrĭdŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n20963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [horridus], <hi rend="ital">standing up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">projecting forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protuberant; rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rugged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rude.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20963.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">papillae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 66</bibl></cit>: caput ungunt horridulum, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 423, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:98:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 98, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comes,</quote> <trans><tr>shabby</tr>, <tr>poor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:54" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 54</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n20963.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of discourse or style, <hi rend="ital">rude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpolished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unadorned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua illa horridula mihi atque incomta visa sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationes Catonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:45:152" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 45, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horridula ejus verba et rudia flosculos Tullianos appellans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
horridus: <entryFree id="n20964" type="main" key="horri^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">horrĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>horreo</etym>, <sense id="n20964.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">standing on end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sticking out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shaggy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bristly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prickly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non hac barbula, qua ista delectatur, sed illa horrida, quam in statuis antiquis et imaginibus videmus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caesaries,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pluma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes horridi pili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:3:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">apes horridae aspectu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 18, 19, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 407</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">videar tibi amarior herbis, Horridior rusco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 7, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">densis hastilibus horrida myrtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor spinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 15, 34, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrida siccae silva comae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:12" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 12</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n20964.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rugged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wild</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">horrid.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20964.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrida signis chlamys,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:558" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 558</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">aspera signis pocula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 263</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra videres Horrida paedore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1269</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecudis jecur horridum et exile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:13:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 13, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrida villosa corpora veste tegant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:75" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:514" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 514</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ilia cultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 6, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Acestes in jaculis et pelle Libystidis ursae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Silvanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 22</bibl></cit>: Africa terribili tremit horrida terra tumultu, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=153" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 153</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 311 Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Aetnensis ager et campus Leontinus sic erat deformis atque horridus, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:18:section=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 18, § 47 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horridior locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:3:83" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 3, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva fuit, late dumis atque ilice nigra Horrida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 382</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes Taenari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:34:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 34, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumenta, velut horrida et confragosa, vitantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:8:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde senilis Hiems tremulo venit horrida passu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 212</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Juppiter horridus austris Torquet aquosam hiemem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:670" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 670</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bruma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:442" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 442</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">December,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:36:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 36, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stiria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:366" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 366</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grando,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 449</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:1" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 13, 1</bibl></cit>; Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 79, § 349</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:10:3" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 10, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aequora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 24, 40</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: si premerem ventosas horridus Alpes, qs. <hi rend="ital">enveloped in horror</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shuddering</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:16:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 16, 19</bibl>.—Of taste: <cit><quote lang="la">sapor,</quote> <trans><tr>harsh</tr>, <tr>raw</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 13, 33, § 129</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruta silvestris horrida ad effectum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 13, 61, § 131</bibl></cit>: (litterae) succedunt tristes et horridae ... in hoc ipso frangit multo fit horridior (littera<cb n="HORR" />  sexta nostrarum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:28 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 28 sq.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n20964.3" n="2" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">with dishevelled hair</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si magna Asturici cecidit domus, horrida mater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:212" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paelex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20964.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n20964.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Rough</hi> in character or manners, <hi rend="ital">rude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blunt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpolished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncouth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">huncine hominem te amplexari tam horridum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vita sic oratione durus, incultus, horridus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:31:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 31, 117</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vir paulo horridior et durior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: spernitur orator bonus, horridus miles amatur, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 14, 30</bibl> (Ann. v. 273 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">non ille, quamquam Socraticis madet Sermonibus, te negliget horridus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:21:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 21, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidens juventus horrida bracchiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germania,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:746" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 746</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horridus irā (Boreas), etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:685" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 685</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 30, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:205" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 205</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:172" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 172</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspera, tristi, horrida oratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:5:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 5, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">horridiora verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:17:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 17, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam genera dicendi horridiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus Saturnius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita de horridis rebus nitida est oratio tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:14:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 14, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(antiquorum imitatores) fient horridi atque jejuni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20964.6" n="2" level="3"> With the predominating idea of an effect produced, <hi rend="ital">causing tremor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">horror</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frightful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">horrid</hi> (rare, and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for the class. horribilis): horridiore aspectu esse, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 14, 2</bibl>; cf. in a Greek construction with an <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et desit si larga Ceres, tunc horrida cerni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 347</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba horrida aspici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis horrida teli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:408" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 408</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 282</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virga (mortis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:24:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 24, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 378</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paupertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1282</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquilae ac signa, pulverulenta illa et cuspidibus horrida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 3, 4, § 23</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">horrĭdē</orth> (acc. to II. B.), <hi rend="ital">roughly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savagely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sternly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vixit semper inculte atque horride,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 18, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horride inculteque dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:9:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 9, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornamentis utetur horridius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:25:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 25, 86</bibl></cit>: alloqui mitius aut horridius. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 82</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
horrifer: <entryFree id="n20965" type="main" key="horri^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">horrĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype> (archaic <sense id="n20965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> horriferum, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:46:155" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 46, 155</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>horror-fero</etym>, <hi rend="ital">that brings trembling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">terror</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dreadful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">horrible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">horrific</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): unde horrifer Aquiloni' stridor gelidas molitur nives, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:28:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 28, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Boreas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 471</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">axis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:518" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 518</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:307" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 307</bibl></cit>: prodigium horriferum, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:46:155" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 46, 155</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestus (Tartari),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1012" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1012</bibl></cit>: Aegis (= <foreign lang="greek">deinh/</foreign>, Hom.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 435</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Erinys,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:725" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 725</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:996" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 996</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
horrificabilis: <entryFree id="n20966" type="hapax" key="horri^fi^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">horrĭfĭcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>horrificus</etym>, <sense id="n20966.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">causing terror</hi>, <hi rend="ital">horrific</hi>: luctus, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 226, 4</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 617 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
horrifice: <entryFree id="n20967" type="main" key="horri^fi^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">horrĭfĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. horrificus <sense id="n20967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
horrifico: <entryFree id="n20968" type="main" key="horri^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">horrĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>horrificus</etym>, <sense id="n20968.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make rough</hi> or <hi rend="ital">terrible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cause terror</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): flatu placidum mare matutino Horrificans Zephyrus, <hi rend="ital">ruffling</hi>, = crispans, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 271</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ore ferarum Et rictu horrificant galeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:389" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 389</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carcer, catenae, fuga, exsilium horrificaverant dignitatem,</quote> <trans><tr>had made terrible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:21:10" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 21, 10</bibl></cit> Duk.: <cit><quote lang="la">mentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Bell. Get. 250</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">multaque praeterea vatum praedicta piorum Terribili monitu horrificant,</quote> <trans><tr>cause horror</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 465</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
horrificus: <entryFree id="n20969" type="main" key="horri^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">horrĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>horror-facio</etym>, <sense id="n20969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that causes tremor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">terror</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dreadful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frightful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">horrific</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">bustum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:906" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 906</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">letum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:851" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 851</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruinae (Aetnae),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 571</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapsu (Harpyiarum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 225</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:97" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:423" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 423</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caesaries,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:372" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 372</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.— Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">horrĭfĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a manner to cause dread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with affright</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrifice fertur divinae Matris imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:609" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 609</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
horripilatio: <entryFree id="n20970" type="main" key="horri^pi^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">horrĭpĭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>horripilo</etym>, <sense id="n20970.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bristling of the hair</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,030:27:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccl. 27, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
horripilo: <entryFree id="n20971" type="main" key="horri^pi^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">horrĭpĭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>horreo-pilus</etym>, <sense id="n20971.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bristle with hairs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be shaggy</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aures immodicis horripilant auctibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 140</bibl></cit>: horripilo <foreign lang="greek">o)rqotrixa/w</foreign>, horripilatur <foreign lang="greek">o)rqotrixei=</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
horrisonus: <entryFree id="n20972" type="main" key="horri^so^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">horrĭsŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>horreo-sonus</etym>, <sense id="n20972.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sounding dreadfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that makes a horrid sound</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): fretum, Cic. poët. <cb n="HORT" /> Tusc. 2, 10, 23; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">flatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:455" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 455</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fragor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fremitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cardo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 573</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">buxus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:584" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 584</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:149" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 149</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
horror: <entryFree id="n20973" type="main" key="horror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">horror</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>horreo</etym>, <sense id="n20973.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a standing on end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">standing erect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bristling.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20973.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">comarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 154</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:229" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 229</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontus non horrore tremit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>was not ruffled</tr>, <tr>agitated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:446" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 446</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">montes horrore nivali semper obducti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n20973.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">roughness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rudeness</hi> of speech: <cit><quote lang="la">veterem illum horrorem malim quam istam novam licentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20973.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (cf. horreo, II.). </sense><sense id="n20973.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A shaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trembling.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20973.5" n="1" level="3"> In gen. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">tremulo ramos horrore moveri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:345" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 345</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horror soli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20973.6" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n20973.7" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A shaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shivering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coldfit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ague-fit</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mihi frigidus horror Membra quatit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:563" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 563</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigus voco ubi extremae partes membrorum inalgescunt: horrorem, ubi totum corpus intremit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atticam doleo tam diu: sed quoniam jam sine horrore est, spero esse ut volumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrorem tertianae et quartanae minuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 72, § 150</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20973.8" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A shaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shuddering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trembling</hi> with fright; <hi rend="ital">dread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terror</hi>, <hi rend="ital">horror</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">est ea frigida multa, comes formidinis, aura, quae ciet horrorem membris et concitat artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 291</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea res me horrore afficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">di immortales, qui me horror perfudit! quam sum sollicitus, quidnam futurum sit!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me luridus occupat horror Spectantem vultus etiamnum caede madentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigidus artus, Dum loquor, horror habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:291" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 291</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectare in eadem harena feras horror est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 1, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20973.9" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A shaking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trembling with joy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetus per artus horror iit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:494" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 494</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">me quaedam divina voluptas percipit atque horror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:29 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 29 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n20973.10" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Dread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">veneration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">religious awe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic numinis ingens horror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:433" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 433</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arboribus suus horror inest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:411" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 411</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos horrore imbuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfusus horrore venerabundusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 16, 6</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n20973.11" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That which causes dread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a terror</hi>, <hi rend="ital">horror</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">serrae stridentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:411" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 411</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">validi ferri natura et frigidus horror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1011" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1011</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scipiadas, belli fulmen, Carthaginis horror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1034" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 1034</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">imitated by Sil.: jacet campis Carthaginis horror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:340" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 340</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
horsum: <entryFree id="n20974" type="main" key="horsum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">horsum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>contr. from hoc = huc and vorsum</etym>, <sense id="n20974.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hitherwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hither</hi>, <hi rend="ital">this way</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pergunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 4, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horsum se capessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 33</bibl>: te adiget horsum insomnia <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 1, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hortalus: <entryFree id="n20975" type="main" key="Horta^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hortălus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">surname of the orator</hi> Q. Hortensius <hi rend="ital">and his descendants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 25, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 15, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hortamen: <entryFree id="n20976" type="main" key="horta_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hortāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>hortor</etym>, <sense id="n20976.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an incitement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encouragement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhortation</hi> (not anteAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">non est hortamine longo Nunc, ait, utendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 277</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Decii eventus, ingens hortamen ad omnia pro re publica audenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:29:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 29, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamoris et verberis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 11, 3</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortamina, laudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:93" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibos et hortamina pugnantibus gestant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
hortamentum: <entryFree id="n20977" type="main" key="horta_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hortāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20977.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an incitement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encouragement</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.) ea cuncta Romanis hortamento erant, Sall J. 98, 7: <cit><quote lang="la">celeritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:24:21" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 24, 21</bibl></cit>: virtutis <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 5, 9</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">in conspectu parentum conjugumque ac liberorum, quae magna etiam absentibus hortamenta animi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 19, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hortanum: <entryFree id="n20978" type="main" key="Horta_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hortānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n20978.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Etruria</hi> (probably called after the Etruscan goddess Horta, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:4:8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> 4, 8</bibl>; cf. Müll. Etrusk. II. p. 62), now <hi rend="ital">Orte</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 52</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hortīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of Hortanum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">classes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:716" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 716</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hortatio: <entryFree id="n20979" type="main" key="horta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hortātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>hortor</etym>, <sense id="n20979.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an encouragement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhortation</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">jam hoc loco non hortatione neque praeceptis, sed precibus tecum fraternis ago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:14:section=41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 14, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortatio non est necessaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 14, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi grata tua est hortatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille in castigationem, hic in hortationem amorum compositus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 54</bibl></cit> Spald.: clamor (oppidanorum) permixtus<pb n="866" /> <cb n="HORT" />  hortatione, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 60:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 60, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">remigum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hortationes ad philosophiam,</quote> <trans><tr>the title of a treatise by Augustus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:85" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 85</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hortativus: <entryFree id="n20980" type="main" key="horta_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hortātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hortor</etym>, <sense id="n20980.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that serves for encouragement</hi> or <hi rend="ital">exhortation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hortative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus (dicendi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:83" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adverbia, i. e. eia, age, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1021</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
hortator: <entryFree id="n20981" type="main" key="horta_tor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hortātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20981.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inciter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encourager</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhorter</hi> (class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">monitor, impulsor, admonitor): cum ejus studii tibi et hortator et magister esset domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:55:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 55, 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:529" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 529</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">isto hortatore, auctore, intercessore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:38:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 38, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortatore non egetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: hortatore bono, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=363" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 363</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 471 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">quasi in mari Solet hortator remiges hortarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">requiemque modumque Voce dabat remis, animorum hortator Epopeus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:619" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 619</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n20982" type="main" key="Horta_tor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hortātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hortatorius: <entryFree id="n20983" type="main" key="horta_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hortātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hortator</etym>, <sense id="n20983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">encouraging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheering</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">irrisio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 8:11" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 8, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Cant. Cantic. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus hortatorius ad fidem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 8, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
